shows.synopsis: Ivo van Hove's reimagined revival of the classic musical about rival New York City gangs, the Jets and the Sharks, and the ill-fated romance between Tony and Maria. The production featured bold multimedia staging and Anne Teresa De Keersmaeker's choreography.

creativeTeam.name: Jonathan Tunick, Leonard Bernstein, Sid Ramin and Irwin Kostal

shows.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
shows.synopsis: In the intimate confines of a college campus, a married couple's volatile relationship is laid bare as they entertain a younger pair of guests. As the night progresses, dark secrets and bitter resentments are unearthed, igniting a war of words and emotions that captivates and unnerves the audience. "Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?" is a searing examination of the complexities of human connection, where the line between love and hate becomes increasingly blurred.

shows.title: The Boys in the Band
shows.synopsis: Celebrating its 50th Anniversary, the groundbreaking comic drama THE BOYS IN THE BAND will appear on Broadway for the first time ever in a strictly limited 15-week engagement this spring. MART CROWLEY’s landmark 1968 play centers on a group of gay men who gather in a NYC apartment for a friend’s birthday party. After the drinks are poured and the music turned up, the evening slowly exposes the fault-lines beneath their friendships and the self-inflicted heartache that threatens their solidarity.

shows.title: Straight White Men
shows.synopsis: It’s Christmas Eve, and Ed has gathered his three adult sons to celebrate with matching pajamas, trash-talking, and Chinese takeout. But when a question they can’t answer interrupts their holiday cheer, they are forced to confront their own identities. Obie Award-winning playwright Young Jean Lee takes a hilariously ruthless look at the classic American father-son drama. This is one white Christmas like you’ve never seen before.

shows.title: Head Over Heels
shows.synopsis: "Head Over Heels" is the bold and fierce new musical comedy from the visionaries that rocked Broadway with "Hedwig and the Angry Inch," "Avenue Q" and "Spring Awakening." Set to the iconic music of the 1980's all-female rock band The Go-Go's, it includes the hit songs “We Got the Beat,” “Our Lips Are Sealed,” “Vacation,” Belinda Carlisle's “Heaven is a Place on Earth,” and many more!

shows.title: Gettin' The Band Back Together
shows.synopsis: Gettin' the Band Back Together is a musical with music and lyrics by Mark Allen and a book by Ken Davenport and the Grundleshotz, a group of performers and writers including Sebastian Arcelus, Fred Berman, Michael Hirstreet, Jenna Coker Jones, Craig Jorczak, Nathan Kaufman, Jay Klaitz, Emily McNamara, Jennifer Miller, Bhavesh Patel, Sarah Saltzberg and Fletcher Young.

shows.title: Pretty Woman: The Musical
shows.synopsis: One of the most beloved romances of all time is coming to Broadway! "Pretty Woman: The Musical" is the World Premiere stage production featuring direction and choreography by two-time Tony Award winner Jerry Mitchell (Kinky Boots, Legally Blonde, Hairspray), an original score by Grammy winner Bryan Adams (“Summer of ’69,” “Everything I Do”) and his longtime songwriting partner Jim Vallance, and a book by the movie’s legendary director Garry Marshall and screenwriter J.F. Lawton.

creativeTeam.name: Kenneth Posner and Philip S. Rosenberg

shows.title: Bernhardt/Hamlet
shows.synopsis: The Tragedy of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, often shortened to Hamlet (), is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare sometime between 1599 and 1601. It is Shakespeare's longest play.

shows.title: The Nap
shows.synopsis: "The Nap" is the American premiere by the author of the rollicking, award-winning Broadway comedy "One Man, Two Guvnors…"

shows.title: The Lifespan of a Fact
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: The determined young fact checker (Daniel Radcliffe) is about to stir up trouble. The demanding editor (Cherry Jones) has given him a big assignment: apply his skill to a groundbreaking piece by the unorthodox author (Bobby Cannavale).

shows.title: The Ferryman
shows.synopsis: The Carney farmhouse is a hive of activity with preparations for the annual harvest. A day of hard work on the land and a traditional night of feasting and celebrations lie ahead. But this year they will be interrupted by a visitor.

shows.title: The Waverly Gallery
shows.synopsis: Iconic actor, comedian, writer, and director Elaine May returns to Broadway for the first time in 50 years in Academy Award winner Kenneth Lonergan’s acclaimed memory play, "The Waverly Gallery."

shows.title: Torch Song
shows.synopsis: After a smash-hit run Off-Broadway, HARVEY FIERSTEIN's "Torch Song" heads to Broadway for a strictly limited engagement. This critically acclaimed production of the Tony Award-winning comedy stars Drama Desk Award winner MICHAEL URIE ("Younger," "Ugly Betty," "Buyer & Cellar") and Academy Award and Tony winner MERCEDES RUEHL ("The Fisher King," "Lost in Yonkers") and is directed by Tony nominee MOISÉS KAUFMAN ("The Laramie Project," "I Am My Own Wife").

shows.title: American Son
shows.synopsis: A Florida police station in the middle of the night; a mother searching for her missing teenage son. "American Son" is a gripping tale of two parents caught in our national divide, with their worst fears hanging in the balance.

shows.title: King Kong
shows.synopsis: KING KONG comes alive through a stunning mix of puppetry, music and stagecraft. This “epic thrill ride” (Variety) follows the ambitious actress Ann Darrow and the filmmaker who promises to make her a star. Together, they voyage from 1930s New York to an uncharted island to capture the world’s greatest wonder. At the center of this theatrical reimagining: a 20-foot high, 2,000-pound ape and the woman who risks everything to help him.

creativeTeam.name: Michael Mitnick, Robert Del Naja, Ian Dench and Amanda Ghost

shows.title: The New One
shows.synopsis: One For The Road is a comedic play by Willy Russell, written in 1976 and published in 1980. The script was revised and updated by Russell in 1985 and the rights are held by Samuel French Ltd.

shows.title: The Prom
shows.synopsis: Everyone’s invited to the joyous Broadway hit that New York Magazine calls “smart and big-hearted” and The New York Times declares a Critic’s Pick! It’s a new musical comedy about big Broadway stars, a small town, and a love that unites them all. Billboard cheers, “The Prom is Hairspray meets Dear Evan Hansen!” Variety raves, “It’s so full of happiness that you think your heart is about to burst.” And The Hollywood Reporter cheers, “It’s comic gold!”

shows.title: The Cher Show
shows.synopsis: For six straight decades, only one unstoppable force has flat-out dominated popular culture — breaking down barriers, pushing boundaries, and letting nothing and no one stand in her way. "The Cher Show" is her story, and it’s packed with so much Cher that it takes three women to play her: the kid starting out, the glam pop star and the icon.

creativeTeam.name: Christine Jones and Brett J. Banakis

shows.title: Network
shows.synopsis: Tony, Olivier, Emmy and Golden Globe-winner Bryan Cranston ("Breaking Bad," "All The Way") makes his triumphant return to Broadway in the National Theatre’s sold-out, critically acclaimed production of "Network."

shows.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
shows.synopsis: In Harper Lee's timeless tale, a young girl named Scout navigates the complexities of racial injustice in 1930s Alabama as her father, Atticus Finch, takes on a challenging case to defend a Black man wrongfully accused of a crime. Set against the backdrop of a sleepy Southern town, this poignant story explores themes of morality, courage, and the enduring power of compassion.

shows.title: Choir Boy
shows.synopsis: Choir Boy is a coming-of-age play by American playwright Tarell Alvin McCraney. The play premiered in September 2012 at the Royal Court Theatre, London, before going on to play productions at New York City Center, Alliance Theatre, Geffen Playhouse, and many more regional theaters across the United States.

shows.title: True West
shows.synopsis: Opposites attack in Sam Shepard’s Pulitzer Prize-nominated play about two brothers with more in common than they think. Holed up in their mother’s California house, lowlife Lee (Ethan Hawke) and screenwriter Austin (Paul Dano) wrestle with big issues—and each other. Order vs. chaos. Art vs. commerce. Typewriter vs. toaster...Shepard’s rip-roaring classic returns to Broadway, gleefully detonating our misguided myths of family, identity and the American Dream.

shows.title: Be More Chill
shows.synopsis: Be More Chill is a musical with original music and lyrics by Joe Iconis, and a book by Joe Tracz, based on the 2004 novel of the same name by Ned Vizzini. After a 2015 regional theatre production, the musical premiered off-Broadway in 2018.

shows.title: Kiss Me, Kate
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: Kiss Me, Kate is a musical with music and lyrics by Cole Porter and a book by Bella and Samuel Spewack. The story involves the production of a musical version of William Shakespeare's The Taming of the Shrew and the conflict on and off-stage between Fred Graham, the show's director, producer, and star, and his leading lady, his ex-wife Lilli Vanessi.

creativeTeam.name: Michael Starobin and Ned Paul Ginsburg

shows.title: Ain't Too Proud
shows.synopsis: Ain't Too Proud: The Life and Times of The Temptations is a 2017 jukebox musical with music and lyrics by The Temptations and a book by Dominique Morisseau. Based on the story of The Temptations, the musical had a series of regional productions and opened at Broadway's Imperial Theatre in March 2019.

creativeTeam.name: Steve Canyon Kennedy and Walter Trarbach

shows.title: What the Constitution Means to Me
shows.synopsis: Fifteen-year-old Heidi Schreck put herself through college by giving speeches about the U.S. Constitution. Now, the Obie Award winner recalls her teenage self in order to trace the profound relationship between four generations of women in her own family and the founding document that dictated their rights and citizenship. This witty and searingly personal exploration breathes new life into our founding document and imagines how it will shape the next generation of American women.

shows.title: King Lear
shows.synopsis:
Once every decade or so, a great actor gives a performance that reminds us why we go to the theater. Last year, that actor was Glenda Jackson in Three Tall Women. Now, she’s back on Broadway, climbing the tallest mountain any actor can climb. Glenda Jackson is KING LEAR.
The Tony® and two-time Oscar® winner plays Lear for 19 weeks only in a new production directed by Sam Gold, leading a cast that includes Jayne Houdyshell (The Humans), Elizabeth Marvel (Other Desert Cities), Aisling O’Sullivan (

shows.title: Oklahoma!
shows.synopsis: Oklahoma! is the first musical written by the duo of Rodgers and Hammerstein. The musical is based on Lynn Riggs's 1931 play, Green Grow the Lilacs.

shows.title: Burn This
shows.synopsis: Academy Award nominee Adam Driver (BlacKkKlansman, Star Wars, “Girls”) and Golden Globe winner Keri Russell (“The Americans,” Waitress, “Felicity”) star in the acclaimed drama by Pulitzer Prize winner Lanford Wilson.

shows.title: Hillary and Clinton
shows.synopsis: Hillary and Clinton is a stage play written by Lucas Hnath that premiered in 2016 at the Victory Gardens Theater in Chicago. The play is set in an alternate universe and tells a story centering on Hillary Clinton's 2008 presidential campaign.

shows.title: Gary: A Sequel to Titus Andronicus
shows.synopsis: Gary: A Sequel to Titus Andronicus is a play written by Taylor Mac. The play is set in the aftermath of William Shakespeare's Titus Andronicus. The play premiered on Broadway in April 2019 starring Nathan Lane and received seven Tony Award nominations.

shows.title: All My Sons
shows.synopsis: Three powerhouse stars. One theatrical masterpiece. The towering achievement of the Broadway season.

shows.title: Tootsie
shows.synopsis: Tootsie is a musical comedy with music and lyrics by David Yazbek and a book by Robert Horn. The musical is based on the 1982 American comedy film of the same name written by Larry Gelbart and Barry Levinson.

shows.title: Ink
shows.synopsis: Ink is a 2017 play by James Graham which premiered in London in 2017.

shows.title: Beetlejuice
shows.synopsis: Beetlejuice, Beetlejuice, Beetlejuice! Say it three times, and the musical adaptation of the 1988 comedy classic will appear for a third Broadway run!
1984 is a 2013 play by Robert Icke and Duncan Macmillan based on the 1949 novel Nineteen Eighty-Four by George Orwell.

shows.title: Marvin's Room
shows.synopsis: Based on the one-man show that inspired the now classic film, this streetwise musical will take you to the stoops of the Bronx in the 1960s—where a young man is caught between the father he loves and the mob boss he’d love to be. Featuring an original doo-wop score, this is a tale about respect, loyalty, love and above all else: family.

shows.title: The Terms of My Surrender
shows.synopsis: Terms of My Surrender is singer-songwriter John Hiatt's twenty-second album, released in 2014. It was produced by Doug Lancio. The album was nominated for two Grammy Awards in 2015.

shows.title: Prince of Broadway
shows.synopsis: Prince of Broadway is a musical revue showcasing the producing career of Harold Prince. Prince himself directed the production, his final Broadway credit.

shows.title: Time and the Conways
shows.synopsis: "Time and the Conways" takes audiences on a captivating journey through the lives of the Conway family, spanning decades with a dazzling twist of time. As the family gathers for a celebratory occasion, their dreams, aspirations, and heartbreaks unfold in a captivating exploration of the fragility of human existence. Audiences are left enchanted by this poignant play that delves deep into the complexities of family, the relentless passage of time, and the resilience of the human spirit.

shows.title: M. Butterfly
shows.synopsis: M. Butterfly is a play by David Henry Hwang. The story, while entwined with that of the opera Madama Butterfly, is based most directly on the relationship between French diplomat Bernard Boursicot and Shi Pei Pu, a Beijing opera singer.

shows.title: Junk
shows.synopsis: Junk: The Golden Age of Debt is a 2016 play by Ayad Akhtar. It premiered at the La Jolla Playhouse in July 2016 and then on Broadway in 2017 and centers on a corporate takeover.

shows.title: The Band's Visit
shows.synopsis: THE BAND’S VISIT is the winner of 10 Tony Awards, making it one of the most Tony-winning musicals in history. In this delightfully offbeat story, set in a town that’s way off the beaten path, a band of musicians arrive lost, out of the blue. Under the spell of the desert sky, and with beautiful music perfuming the air, the band brings the town to life in unexpected and tantalizing ways. Even the briefest visit can stay with you forever.

shows.title: Latin History for Morons
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: A sold-out run at The Public Theater. A record-breaking engagement at Berkeley Rep. Endless critical and audience acclaim. Chalk it all up to the mad genius of Emmy Award winner John Leguizamo, standing at the head of the class in his one-man tour de force, LATIN HISTORY FOR MORONS.

shows.title: Meteor Shower
shows.synopsis: Meteor Shower is a 2016 play written by Steve Martin. The play, a comedy, is set in 1993 in Ojai, California. It premiered on Broadway in 2017.

shows.title: The Parisian Woman
shows.synopsis: In the heart of Washington, D.C., a powerful political player's wife navigates the intricate web of power, privilege, and personal desires. As she maneuvers through the high-stakes game of influence and betrayal, her loyalties are tested, and the lines between love and ambition become increasingly blurred. "The Parisian Woman" is a gripping exploration of the dynamics that shape the political landscape and the personal sacrifices that come with wielding power.

shows.title: Once on This Island
shows.synopsis: Once on This Island is a coming-of-age one-act stage musical with a book and lyrics by Lynn Ahrens and music by Stephen Flaherty. It is based on the 1985 novel My Love, My Love; or, The Peasant Girl by Rosa Guy, a Caribbean-set retelling of Hans Christian Andersen's fairy tale The Little Mermaid.

shows.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
shows.synopsis: A legendary roster of Grammy Award winners. A visionary director and Tony Award-winning design team. One of the world’s most beloved characters. Turn them loose on Broadway and what do you get?

shows.title: The Children
shows.synopsis: However, while highly regarded in Hollywood, Oh is no stranger to the stage: she has appeared off Broadway before, performing at The Public Theater, and has also acted at La Jolla Playhouse in California. Oh is known for her depictions of strong, singular women, and this play will be no different:

shows.title: Farinelli and the King
shows.synopsis: Oscar and three-time Tony winner Mark Rylance, following his acclaimed performance in the hit film Dunkirk, returns to the stage in "Farinelli and the King". This captivating new play arrives on Broadway after sold-out runs at Shakespeare’s Globe and on London’s West End.

shows.title: John Lithgow: Stories By Heart
shows.synopsis: John Arthur Lithgow ( LITH-goh; born October 19, 1945) is an American actor. He studied at Harvard University and the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art before becoming known for his diverse work on stage and screen.

shows.title: Escape to Margaritaville
shows.synopsis: Welcome to Margaritaville, where people come to get away from it all—and stay to find something they never expected.

shows.title: Frozen
shows.synopsis: For the first time, "Frozen" comes to life on Broadway, re-imagined for the stage in a new production by an award-winning team.

shows.title: Lobby Hero
shows.synopsis: Lobby Hero is a play by Kenneth Lonergan. It premiered off-Broadway in 2001.

shows.title: Three Tall Women
shows.synopsis: Two-time Academy Award winner GLENDA JACKSON makes her long-awaited return to Broadway alongside three-time Emmy and Tony winner LAURIE METCALF and Tony nominee ALISON PILL in the Broadway premiere of Edward Albee’s Pulitzer Prize-winning masterpiece, "Three Tall Women."

shows.title: Mean Girls
shows.synopsis: "Mean Girls" is now a ferociously funny new musical from director Casey Nicholaw (Aladdin, The Book of Mormon), composer Jeff Richmond (“30 Rock,” “Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt”), lyricist Nell Benjamin (Legally Blonde) and book writer Tina Fey (“30 Rock,” Bossypants).

shows.title: Children of a Lesser God
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: “If you can see one play on Broadway, it has to be CHILDREN OF A LESSER GOD” declares United Press International. The New York Times calls it “a play unlike any other” and New York Post says it’s “a joyous event full of love and passion. You will never forget it.”

shows.title: Carousel
shows.synopsis: Rodgers & Hammerstein’s "Carousel" has returned to Broadway in a sumptuous production directed by three-time Tony winner Jack O’Brien, starring Joshua Henry and Jessie Mueller, with choreography by New York City Ballet’s Justin Peck. “God is in CAROUSEL,” raves The Chicago Tribune. “It’s the greatest musical ever written.”  Don’t miss the ecstatically acclaimed revival NPR calls “the best musical of the season, by far.”

shows.title: My Fair Lady
shows.synopsis: Don’t miss Lerner & Loewe’s MY FAIR LADY at Lincoln Center Theater, now playing through July 7 only! Directed by Tony® winner Bartlett Sher, this “enchanting and incandescent” (The Washington Post) revival was named the best Broadway musical of 2018 by The New York Times, Entertainment Weekly and Time Magazine. NY1 raves, “it reminds you how indispensable great theater can be.” The New York Times calls it “thrilling, glorious and better than it ever was.”

shows.title: Summer
shows.synopsis: She was a girl from Boston with a voice from heaven who shot through the stars from gospel choir to dance floor diva. But what the world didn’t know was how Donna Summer risked it all to break through barriers, becoming the icon of an era and the supreme queen for every diva who followed.

creativeTeam.name: Colman Domingo, Robert Cary and Des McAnuff
Evan Kidd Bogart, Jonathan Rotem and Donna Summer

shows.title: Travesties
shows.synopsis: Roundabout Theatre Company’s dazzling new production of "Travesties", Tom Stoppard’s 1976 Tony Award-winning Best Play, has arrived—and The New York Times says it’s “ridiculously entertaining.” An artist, a writer and a revolutionary collide in this “giddy, head-spinning triumph” (Entertainment Weekly), a kaleidoscopic thrill-ride through the worlds of art and revolution in 1917 Switzerland…and in the maze of one man’s memory.

shows.title: Saint Joan
shows.synopsis: Catch the hit musical that’s been bringing crime, pizzazz, and all that jazz to Broadway since October 1996 — it would be a crime to miss it. Whitney Leavitt (

shows.title: The Iceman Cometh
shows.synopsis: Two-time Oscar winner and Tony Award winner DENZEL WASHINGTON returns to Broadway in one of the signal roles in the American theatre in Eugene O’Neill’s THE ICEMAN COMETH, for 14 weeks only.

shows.title: Cirque du Soleil Paramour
shows.synopsis: "Cirque du Soleil Paramour" takes audiences on a captivating journey through the golden age of Hollywood. Featuring breathtaking acrobatics and a sweeping, cinematic love story, the production blends Cirque du Soleil's renowned artistry with the glamour and drama of the silver screen. As the lines between reality and fantasy blur, the audience is swept up in a mesmerizing tale of passion, ambition, and the power of the imagination.

shows.title: An Act of God
shows.synopsis: An Act of God is a play by David Javerbaum. The stage play is adapted from Javerbaum's  The Last Testament: A Memoir By God.

shows.title: Motown The Musical
shows.synopsis: Coming back to New York City is 54 Below’s very own Nicole Vanessa Ortiz! After a highly acclaimed Paper Mill Playhouse debut as Disco Diva Deloris Van Cartier in Sister Act The Musical, Nicole Vanessa Ortiz is back onstage for the holidays! Known for her BroadwayWorld Award-nominated one-woman concert Becoming Her: A Diva’s Tribute and show-stealing turns in Off-Broadway productions like Spamilton and Smokey Joe’s Cafe, Nicole is back in town with a whole new live experience: The Disco Odyssey!

shows.title: Cats
shows.synopsis: Cats is a sung-through musical with music by Andrew Lloyd Webber. It is based on the 1939 poetry collection Old Possum's Book of Practical Cats by T. S.

creativeTeam.name: Andrew Lloyd Webber and David Cullen

shows.title: The Encounter
shows.synopsis: Brief Encounter is a 1945 British romantic tragedy film directed by David Lean from a screenplay by Noël Coward, based on his 1936 one-act play Still Life. The film stars Celia Johnson and Trevor Howard in lead roles, alongside Stanley Holloway, Joyce Carey, Cyril Raymond, Everley Gregg and Margaret Barton.

shows.title: Holiday Inn, The New Irving Berlin Musical
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: Mr. Berlin understood the impact dance had on the public and his melodies, rhythms, and lyrics reflected his love of that art form. Six spectacular performers will perform these magnificent songs and will also tell the stories behind the man who made the music that made the movies dance.

shows.title: Oh, Hello on Broadway
shows.synopsis: The Oh, Hello Show is a comedy act created by American comedians Nick Kroll and John Mulaney that was popularized on Comedy Central's Kroll Show. A fictional New York One cable access show stars Gil Faizon (Kroll) and George St.

shows.title: Heisenberg
shows.synopsis: Tony Award winner Blair Brown (Copenhagen, Orange Is the New Black), four-time Emmy Award winner Edie Falco (The Sopranos, Frankie and Johnny…), and Tony Award nominee Marin Ireland (Reasons to Be Pretty) form a powerhouse trio of stars in this deeply felt, gorgeously imagined new play by Tony Award winner Simon Stephens (Heisenberg, The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time).

shows.title: The Cherry Orchard
shows.synopsis: Chekhov’s masterpiece comes to St. Ann’s Warehouse after a critically acclaimed run at London’s Donmar Warehouse, directed by Benedict Andrews (

shows.title: The Front Page
shows.synopsis: The press room of Chicago’s Criminal Courts Building is buzzing with reporters covering the story of an escaped prisoner. When star reporter Hildy Johnson (John Slattery) accidentally discovers the runaway convict, he and his editor Walter Burns (Nathan Lane) conspire to hide the man from the other reporters, while they chase the biggest scoop of their careers.

shows.title: Falsettos
shows.synopsis: Falsettos is a sung-through musical with a book by William Finn and James Lapine, and music and lyrics by Finn. The musical consists of March of the Falsettos (1981) and Falsettoland (1990), the last two installments in a trio of one-act musicals that premiered off-Broadway (the first was In Trousers).

shows.title: Les Liaisons Dangereuses
shows.synopsis: Hugo Marchand’s undeniable virtuosity, lyricism, charisma, and artistry have catapulted him to the height of ballet excellence. He is perhaps the most famous male Étoile in the Paris Opera Ballet—the highest rank in the most prestigious ballet company in the world. He is the curator and lead performer of City Center’s fifth Artists at the Center program, the most ambitious to date.

shows.title: Natasha, Pierre & The Great Comet of 1812
shows.synopsis: Natasha, Pierre & The Great Comet of 1812 (or simply The Great Comet) is a sung-through musical adaptation of a 70-page segment from Leo Tolstoy's 1869 novel War and Peace. The show was written by composer, lyricist, playwright, orchestrator Dave Malloy and originally directed by Rachel Chavkin.

shows.title: A Bronx Tale The Musical
shows.synopsis: A Bronx Tale is a musical based on the play by the same name with a book by Chazz Palminteri, music by Alan Menken, and lyrics by Glenn Slater. After a ten-year development process, the original one man show was adapted into a new musical and premiered at the Paper Mill Playhouse in Millburn, New Jersey on February 4, 2016, before opening on Broadway December 1 later that year.

creativeTeam.name: Robert De Niro and Jerry Zaks

shows.title: Dear Evan Hansen
shows.synopsis: "Dear Evan Hansen" is the deeply personal and profoundly contemporary musical about life and the way we live it.

shows.title: In Transit
shows.synopsis: In Transit is a one-act musical with book, music and lyrics by Kristen Anderson-Lopez, James-Allen Ford, Russ Kaplan and Sara Wordsworth. The musical, performed entirely a cappella, ran Off-Broadway in 2010, and on Broadway in 2016.

creativeTeam.name: Kristen Anderson-Lopez, James-Allen Ford, Russ Kaplan and Sara Wordsworth
Kristen Anderson-Lopez, James-Allen Ford, Russ Kaplan and Sara Wordsworth
Kristen Anderson-Lopez, James-Allen Ford, Russ Kaplan and Sara Wordsworth

shows.title: The Present
shows.synopsis: Platonov (Russian: Платонов, also known as Fatherlessness and A Play Without a Title) is the name in English given to an early, untitled play in four acts written by Anton Chekhov in 1878. It was the first large-scale drama by Chekhov, written specifically for Maria Yermolova, rising star of Maly Theatre.

shows.title: Jitney
shows.synopsis: Jitney is a play by American playwright August Wilson. The eighth in his "Pittsburgh Cycle", this play is set in a worn-down illegal taxi operation station in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, in early autumn 1977.

shows.title: Sunset Boulevard
shows.synopsis: Sunset Boulevard is a musical with music by Andrew Lloyd Webber, and lyrics and libretto by Don Black and Christopher Hampton, based on the 1950 film. The plot follows Norma Desmond, a faded star of the silent-screen era, living in her decaying mansion on Sunset Boulevard in 1949 Los Angeles.

creativeTeam.name: David Cullen and Andrew Lloyd Webber

shows.title: Sunday in the Park with George
shows.synopsis: Jake Gyllenhaal makes his Broadway musical debut alongside Tony winner Annaleigh Ashford in the Stephen Sondheim/James Lapine Pulitzer Prize-winning masterpiece SUNDAY IN THE PARK WITH GEORGE. The three-night only production at City Center was one of the most rapturously acclaimed theatrical events of the season, and now it is headed to Broadway to open the highly-anticipated new Hudson Theatre where it will play a strictly limited engagement for 10 weeks only.

shows.title: Significant Other
shows.synopsis: ACTOR THERAPY is back at 54 Below! Brought to you by award-winning composer-lyricist Ryan Scott Oliver (35mm, Jasper in Deadland) and Tony Award® winning Broadway actress Lindsay Mendez (Carousel, Significant Other, Wicked), ACTOR THERAPY is a series of masterclasses for performers looking to improve their auditions, build a better book, and expand their understanding of what it means to be an actor and song interpreter in New York today.

shows.title: The Glass Menagerie
shows.synopsis: Two-time Academy Award winner Sally Field and two-time Tony Award winner Joe Mantello star in Tennessee Williams’ THE GLASS MENAGERIE on Broadway. Also starring Finn Wittrock and Madison Ferris. Tony winner Sam Gold directs.

shows.title: Come From Away
shows.synopsis: This New York Times Critics’ Pick takes you into the heart of the remarkable true story of 7,000 stranded passengers and the small town in Newfoundland that welcomed them. Cultures clashed and nerves ran high, but uneasiness turned into trust, music soared into the night, and gratitude grew into enduring friendships.

shows.title: The Price
shows.synopsis: Set in an attic of a condemned Manhattan building, this compelling play examines the price we pay for the choices we make or fail to make in life. Four unforgettable characters struggle to make sense of the past and create a future in this 1968 tour de force masterpiece of Miller’s pen.

shows.title: Miss Saigon
shows.synopsis: Direct from its smash London run, Cameron Mackintosh's stunning new production of Boublil and Schonberg's legendary musical MISS SAIGON lands on Broadway in March, 2017, featuring its acclaimed stars Eva Noblezada and Jon Jon Briones.

creativeTeam.name: Richard Maltby, Jr. and Alain Boublil

shows.title: Sweat
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: Filled with warm humor and tremendous heart, SWEAT tells the story of a group of friends who have spent their lives sharing drinks and laughs while working together on the factory floor. But when layoffs and picket lines begin to chip away at their trust, they find themselves pitted against each other in a heart-wrenching fight to stay afloat.

shows.title: The Play That Goes Wrong
shows.synopsis: The Play That Goes Wrong is a play by Henry Lewis, Jonathan Sayer, and Henry Shields of Mischief Theatre Company. The story follows a performance of a murder mystery, where the ill-fated theatre company encounters numerous mishaps.

shows.title: Amélie, A New Musical
shows.synopsis: Tony nominee Phillipa Soo returns to Broadway in AMÉLIE, a new musical based on the beloved five-time Oscar-nominated film, and "an enchanting act of theatrical reinvention” (Los Angeles Times).

shows.title: Present Laughter
shows.synopsis: Kevin Kline makes his eagerly awaited return to Broadway in Noël Coward’s outrageously irresistible backstage comedy PRESENT LAUGHTER.

shows.title: War Paint
shows.synopsis: Two-time Tony Award-winning legends Patti LuPone and Christine Ebersole join forces to portray trailblazing cosmetic icons who built empires in a business world ruled by men with performances The New York Times calls “delicious. Both stars are knockouts.”

creativeTeam.name: Peter John Still and Marc Salzberg

shows.title: Groundhog Day
shows.synopsis: 2017 Olivier, Drama Desk and Outer Critics Award winner for Best Actor, Andy Karl, plays Phil Connors—a disgruntled weatherman mysteriously stuck in small-town America reliving the same day over and over and over again—with no consequences, no regrets, no tomorrows, and no hangovers. But once he gets to know associate TV producer Rita Hanson, he discovers it’s a day of second, third and fourth chances.

shows.title: Hello, Dolly!
shows.synopsis: Winner of 4 Tony Awards including Best Revival of a Musical, this universally acclaimed new production of "Hello, Dolly!' “is making people crazy happy” (The Washington Post). Two-time Tony Award-winning stage icon Donna Murphy stars in select performances as Dolly Gallagher Levi beginning July 22. "Hello, Dolly!" also stars Tony winner David Hyde Pierce.

shows.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
shows.synopsis: ROALD DAHL’s most treasured tale has arrived in the land where sweet dreams come true—Broadway—starring two-time Tony Award winner CHRISTIAN BORLE (Something Rotten!, Peter and the Starcatcher) as the magical maestro Willy Wonka himself. And who better to conjure up this confectionary wonder than three-time Tony Award-winning director JACK O’BRIEN  (Hairspray, The Front Page).

shows.title: Anastasia
shows.synopsis: From the Tony Award-winning creators of the Broadway classic Ragtime, this dazzling show transports us from the twilight of the Russian Empire to the euphoria of Paris in the 1920s, as a brave young woman sets out to discover the mystery of her past. Pursued by a ruthless Soviet officer determined to silence her, Anya enlists the aid of a dashing conman and a lovable ex-aristocrat. Together, they embark on an epic adventure to help her find home, love, and family.

shows.title: Amazing Grace
shows.synopsis: “When I first started writing Reunions, I envisioned the show in New York and here we are with a great cast and team,” said bookwriter and lyricist Jeffrey Scharf. “The underlying materials are wonderful examples of dramady with a shared theme that is timeless and universal – who hasn’t wondered what a ‘we meet again’ moment would be like?  Musicalizing heightens the impact and poignancy in a way I hope audiences will find entertaining and relatable.”

shows.title: Fool for Love
shows.synopsis: A daughter’s road trip with her father becomes a theatrical journey across more than just state lines. This funny, wise, and heartbreaking debut from an exciting new writer will be brought to vibrant life by director Daniel Aukin, whom MTC audiences will remember from Fool for Love and Fulfillment Center.

shows.title: The Gin Game
shows.synopsis: Two elderly residents of a nursing home, Fonsia and Weller, strike up an unlikely friendship through a game of gin rummy. As the game progresses, their innocent pastime reveals deeper truths about their lives, loneliness, and the harsh realities of growing old. The Gin Game is a poignant exploration of the human condition, where the stakes are high, and the players must confront their own demons.

shows.title: Dames at Sea
shows.synopsis:
Act 1: 1928 - Present Arms, The New Moon, Blackbirds of 1928, Animal Crackers, Whoopee, and more!
Act 2: 1935 - Porgy and Bess, At Home Abroad, Jubilee, May Wine, Jumbo, and more!

shows.title: Sylvia
shows.synopsis: Taroon once served as an interpreter for the U.S. military in Afghanistan. Now it is 2013, and the Americans — and their promises of safety — have begun to withdraw. Taroon spends his days in hiding, a target of the increasingly powerful Taliban. On the eve of his son’s birth, he must remain in his sister’s apartment, or risk his life to see his child. With shattering precision, Sylvia Khoury’s tense drama traces the human cost of U.S. immigration policy and the legacy of our longest war.

shows.title: Thérèse Raquin
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: Thérèse Raquin is a gripping psychological thriller set in 19th-century Paris. Trapped in a loveless marriage, Thérèse embarks on a passionate affair with her husband's friend, setting off a chain of devastating consequences that will test the limits of their moral and emotional resolve. As guilt and paranoia consume them, the characters find themselves entangled in a web of deceit and murder, leading to a shocking and unforgettable climax.

shows.title: King Charles III
shows.synopsis: The legendary true crime story that captivated audiences in the acclaimed film is now a live, pulse-pounding Broadway event.

shows.title: On Your Feet!
shows.synopsis: For Emilio and Gloria Estefan, Havana would always be home. But America—and music history— was their destiny. Discover the remarkable true story of how they made their American dream come true in the smash hit Broadway musical, ON YOUR FEET!

creativeTeam.name: SCK Sound Design and Andrew Keister
Gloria M. Estefan and Enrique E. Garcia

shows.title: Allegiance
shows.synopsis: Pearl Harbor rocked the United States. Shortly after, Executive Order 9066 authorised the evacuation of all people deemed a national security to relocation centres — this included Japanese Americans. George Takei was one of 120,000 sent to these internment camps: Camp Rohwer in Arkansas, and then Camp Tule in northern California.

creativeTeam.name: Marc Acito, Jay Kuo and Lorenzo Thione

shows.title: A View From the Bridge
shows.synopsis: A View from the Bridge is a play by American playwright Arthur Miller. It was first staged on September 29, 1955, as a one-act verse drama with A Memory of Two Mondays at the Coronet Theatre on Broadway.

shows.title: China Doll
shows.synopsis: In "China Doll," a wealthy businessman finds his life thrown into chaos when a seemingly straightforward business transaction takes an unexpected turn. As he navigates the dangerous web of deceit and betrayal, he must confront the consequences of his own actions and uncover the truth before it's too late. This gripping thriller offers audiences a captivating glimpse into the high-stakes world of power, corruption, and the fragility of the human condition.

shows.title: School of Rock – The Musical
shows.synopsis: The musical follows Dewey Finn, a wannabe rock star posing as a substitute teacher at a prestigious prep school. Disinterested in academics, Dewey creates his own curriculum, turning his class into a guitar-shredding, bass-slapping, mind-blowing rock band.

creativeTeam.name: Brenda Russell, Allee Willis and Stephen Bray
Brenda Russell, Allee Willis and Stephen Bray

shows.title: Fiddler on the Roof
shows.synopsis: Many of the cast members from that production are returning for the 2022 revival, led by Steven Skybell in his Lucille Lortel Award-winning role as Tevye.

shows.title: Our Mother's Brief Affair
shows.synopsis: A family gathers to mourn the sudden passing of their matriarch, only to discover a shocking secret from her past that threatens to upend everything they thought they knew about her. As they sift through the fragments of her life, the truth slowly emerges, forcing them to confront their own preconceptions and the complex nature of love, identity, and the bonds of family.

shows.title: The Humans
shows.synopsis: THE HUMANS is the winner of 4 Tony Awards. Charles Isherwood of The New York Times cheers, “Stephen Karam’s play is a major discovery — blisteringly funny, bruisingly sad, and altogether wonderful; it’s the best play of the year.” New York Magazine raves, “‘The Humans’ is not just a play for now, but for all time. It’s the best play of the year.” It’s “hilarious, heartbreaking and unforgettable — the best play of the year,” says Entertainment Weekly. The Chicago Tribune cheers, “Few writers of S

shows.title: Disaster!
shows.synopsis: This October, for a strictly limited engagement, Tony Award® winner and Broadway legend André De Shields opens the doors of the House of the Redeemer (7 E 95th) to only his most devoted disciples for a decadent spectacle. Within an historic Upper East Side mansion rarely opened to the public, De Shields and his ensemble invite just 100 guests per night to a sumptuous evening of ritual and revelry inspired by Molière’s notorious deceiver, Tartuffe.

shows.title: Blackbird
shows.synopsis: Anna Christie enters demanding not just a drink, but one made on her own terms, to her own liking. With that entrance, Eugene O’Neill cracked open a new age of modern drama, putting vibrant, smart, and independent women on stage, and centering a whole story around their dreams and difficulties.

shows.title: She Loves Me
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre

shows.title: The Crucible
shows.synopsis: This new play has played in Boston and Washington, DC, where it got rave reviews. The Boston Globe calling it “genuinely funny and deadly serious,” and The Washington Post said, "Not only has Kimberly Belflower ingeniously set up nuanced resonances with America’s broader civic zeitgeist, she has also written a touching, and sometimes hilarious, portrait of bracingly specific 21st-century young people."

shows.title: The Father
shows.synopsis: The Father (Swedish: Fadren) is a naturalistic tragedy by  Swedish playwright August Strindberg, written in 1887. It is about the struggle between parents over the future of their child; resulting in the mother, using her cunning manipulative skills, subduing and finally destroying the father.

shows.title: Waitress
shows.synopsis: Ciara Renée (Frozen) and Tony nominee Joshua Henry (Carousel, Violet) are heading to the diner and will take over the roles of Jenna and Dr. Pomatter. Renée will begin performances on November 25 while Henry will start her shift on November 29.

creativeTeam.name: Sara Bareilles and The Waitress Band

shows.title: Fully Committed
shows.synopsis: Three powerhouse stars. One theatrical masterpiece. The towering achievement of the Broadway season.

shows.title: Tuck Everlasting
shows.synopsis: The use of cameras, cell phones, and other recording devices during the show is strictly prohibited by law, except when used for accessibility services. No weapons permitted on the premises.

shows.title: Long Day's Journey Into Night
shows.synopsis: “Inarguably one of the greatest dramas in the history of the American theater” (Chicago Tribune), Eugene O'Neill’s LONG DAY’S JOURNEY INTO NIGHT receives a vibrant and timely update in this interpretation by prolific, Tony Award®-nominated director Robert O’Hara (Slave Play).

shows.title: Shuffle Along, Or The Making of the Musical Sensation of 1921 and All That Followed
shows.synopsis: "Shuffle Along" transports audiences to the vibrant world of 1920s Harlem, where a group of daring African-American artists strive to create a groundbreaking musical that will shatter racial barriers and captivate the nation. Blending a thrilling backstage drama with electrifying musical numbers, the show immerses viewers in the triumphs and struggles of these pioneers, whose trailblazing work paved the way for generations of Black entertainers. A celebration of the power of art to inspire change, "Shuffle Along" offers a thrilling and unforgettable theatrical experience.

creativeTeam.name: F. E. Miller and Aubrey Lyles

shows.title: This Is Our Youth
shows.synopsis: Iconic actor, comedian, writer, and director Elaine May returns to Broadway for the first time in 50 years in Academy Award winner Kenneth Lonergan’s acclaimed memory play, "The Waverly Gallery."

shows.title: Love Letters
shows.synopsis: Sign up to our mailing list to receive exclusive offers, new show ticket alerts and seasonal promotions. You can unsubscribe at any time.

shows.title: You Can't Take It With You
The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
shows.synopsis: The acclaimed National Theatre production of THE CURIOUS INCIDENT OF THE DOG IN THE NIGHT-TIME is “the most inventive new show on Broadway” (New York Post). Tony Award winner Marianne Elliott (War Horse) directs this “dazzling” (Associated Press) adaptation by two-time Olivier Award winner Simon Stephens that brings Mark Haddon’s internationally best-selling novel to “extraordinary” life (TIME Magazine).

creativeTeam.name: Scott Graham, Steven Hoggett and Frantic Assembly
Scott Graham , Steven Hoggett and Frantic Assembly

shows.title: On the Town
shows.synopsis: On the Town is a musical with music by Leonard Bernstein and book and lyrics by Betty Comden and Adolph Green, based on Jerome Robbins' idea for his  1944 ballet Fancy Free, which he had set to Bernstein's music. The musical introduced several popular and classic songs, among them "New York, New York", "Lonely Town", "I Can Cook, Too" (for which Bernstein also wrote the lyric), and "Some Other Time".

shows.title: Disgraced
shows.synopsis: Ayad Akhtar’s fiery Pulitzer Prize-winning drama that took Broadway by storm will keep you on the edge of your seat and inspire debate long after you leave the theater. Amir Kapoor is a successful lawyer at a prestigious Manhattan law firm. He is married to a beautiful woman and is just trying to live a good life. When conversations at a dinner party turn confrontational, racial and religious tension forces him to face his own ambition and stifled cultural identity.

shows.title: The Last Ship
shows.synopsis: Two-time Tony® Award nominee Kate Baldwin (Hello, Dolly!, Big Fish, Finian’s Rainbow) and Broadway and television star Aaron Lazar (The Light in the Piazza, Fox’s “Filthy Rich,” The Last Ship) are back for a return engagement of their smash hit show All For You.

creativeTeam.name: Jeff Barry, Ellie Greenwich and Philip Spector

shows.title: A Delicate Balance
shows.synopsis: Sign up to our mailing list to receive exclusive offers, new show ticket alerts and seasonal promotions. You can unsubscribe at any time.

shows.title: The Elephant Man
shows.synopsis: A searing and provocative world premiere by actor/writer Tim Blake Nelson, directed by Mark Wing-Davey.

shows.title: Constellations
shows.synopsis: Jake Gyllenhaal and Tom Sturridge come to Hudson Theatre on Broadway, for a limited engagement thru September 29.

shows.title: Honeymoon in Vegas
shows.synopsis: Combining timeless music with wit, charm, storytelling, and a dash of soft shoe and ukulele performances, Tony Danza is accompanied by his talented four-piece band. Danza performs a selection of his favorite standards from the Great American Songbook, as well as selections from the hit Broadway musical Honeymoon in Vegas (which he also starred in), while interweaving stories about his life and personal connection to the music.

creativeTeam.name: Don Sebesky, Larry Blank, Jason Robert Brown and Charlie Rosen
Don Sebesky , Larry Blank , Jason Robert Brown and Charlie Rosen

shows.title: Fish in the Dark
shows.synopsis: Join La Muerte, the boozy ruler of the underworld, and their adorably ill-made Diablito as they bicker over what worlds to weed in the coming “great reckoning” of their beloved garden. New York Innovative Theater Award nominee Christian De Gré Cárdenas returns to 54 Below with a dark and twisted, unsettling and hilarious, debaucherous retrospective of five fantastical worlds, spanning two centuries, on the verge of total blissful collapse.

shows.title: On the Twentieth Century
shows.synopsis: On the Twentieth Century is a musical with book and lyrics by Betty Comden and Adolph Green and music by Cy Coleman. Based partly on the 1932 play Twentieth Century and its 1934 film adaptation, the musical is part operetta, part farce and part screwball comedy.

shows.title: The Heidi Chronicles
shows.synopsis: Thunder Media Group is proud to present the New York Premiere of An Enchanted April: a new musical, with Book & Lyrics by Elizabeth Hansen and Music & Lyrics by C. Michael Perry based on the Novel by Elizabeth von Arnim.  Under the direction of Alice Jankell, An Enchanted April is scheduled for a limited run at Theatre Two @ Theatre Row (410 West 42nd St.) opening on November 1 and running through November 16.

shows.title: Skylight
shows.synopsis: In contemporary Manhattan, Eric and Toby are 30-somethings who seem to be very much in love and thriving. But on the cusp of their engagement, they meet an older man haunted by the past, and a younger man hungry for a future. Chance meetings lead to surprising choices as the lives of three generations interlink and collide—with explosive results.

shows.title: Hand to God
shows.synopsis: Kevin Kline makes his eagerly awaited return to Broadway in Noël Coward’s outrageously irresistible backstage comedy PRESENT LAUGHTER.

shows.title: Gigi
shows.synopsis: Last chance to embark on a great adventure! See the most Tony®-winning show of the 2023 season before April 28.

shows.title: It Shoulda Been You
shows.synopsis: Have you ever thought that there are simply not enough Hanukkah songs? Wonder no more! For the second year, 54 Below will be showcasing some of the best Jewish musical theatre writers as they each present a brand new, original Hanukkah song. Join them along with some of Broadway’s biggest mensches as we give the festival of lights the songbook it deserves. You’ll want the miraculous, musical magic to last for eight days and beyond!

shows.title: Finding Neverland
shows.synopsis: Come join Growing Up Broadway for a special one-night event as current and former Broadway kids return to Feinstein’s/54 Below for the first time since 2020 as they sing songs from hit musicals they were once in, would have loved to be in, or someday wish to be apart of! This is a comeback performance for theater lovers young and young at heart alike! Conceived and Produced by (former Broadway kid) Dara Paige Bloomfield.

shows.title: The King and I
shows.synopsis: The King and I is the fifth musical by the team of Rodgers and Hammerstein. It is based on Margaret Landon's novel Anna and the King of Siam (1944), which is in turn derived from the memoirs of Anna Leonowens, governess to the children of King Mongkut of Siam in the early 1860s.

shows.title: Living on Love
shows.synopsis: Fool for Love is a play written by American playwright and actor Sam Shepard. The play focuses on May and Eddie, former lovers who have met again in a motel in the desert.

shows.title: Doctor Zhivago
shows.synopsis: From Aretha to Britney, Elvis to Prince, Kelli Barrett (Wicked, Doctor Zhivago, FX’s “Fosse/Verdon”) and Jarrod Spector (Beautiful: The Carole King Musical, Jersey Boys, The Cher Show) cover the gamut of musical royalty, spotlighting how this select group ascended to their respective thrones and created the most iconic and beloved hits of all time.

creativeTeam.name: SCK Sound Design, Walter Trarbach and Andrew Keister
Ned Ginsburg, Louis King and David Siegel

shows.title: Airline Highway
shows.synopsis: In the vibrant heart of New Orleans, a motley crew of eccentric characters gathers at the Hummingbird Motel to honor the life of a beloved burlesque performer. As the day unfolds, their stories intertwine, revealing a tapestry of love, loss, and the resilience of the human spirit. Airline Highway is a poignant exploration of the marginalized and the universal desire for community, inviting the audience to experience the raw, bittersweet moments that define the lives of those often overlooked.

shows.title: The Visit
shows.synopsis: Join students from NYU Steinhardt‘s Vocal Performance program in Musical Theatre as they bring “Cloud 9” to the 54 Below stage! They are a collection of artists from all corners of the world that came to New York with the same dream and found each other while pursuing a Masters in Vocal Performance at NYU Steinhardt.

shows.title: First Date
shows.synopsis: Two monumental actors, Audra McDonald and Michael Shannon, join forces in a play that is as raw as it is romantic, as visceral as it is vibrant, and as funny as it is breathtaking. When a diner waitress and a short order cook meet for a night of fiery passion, they expect a return to loneliness. But as desire turns into the possibility of love, they realize that true connection means being unafraid to reach for the moon.

shows.title: The Glass Menagerie
shows.synopsis: Two-time Academy Award winner Sally Field and two-time Tony Award winner Joe Mantello star in Tennessee Williams’ THE GLASS MENAGERIE on Broadway. Also starring Finn Wittrock and Madison Ferris. Tony winner Sam Gold directs.

shows.title: A Night with Janis Joplin
shows.synopsis: Nattalyee Randall, co-creator of March on Broadway, returns to 54 Below with her debut solo show at the venue: My Love/Hate Relationship With NYC!

shows.title: The Winslow Boy
shows.synopsis: Nominated for seven Tony Awards (including Best Musical), The Tap Dance Kid tells the story of Willie, a 10-year-old boy from an upper-middle-class Black family, who dreams of becoming a professional tap dancer, despite his father’s disapproval.

shows.title: A Time to Kill
shows.synopsis: Inspired by Lee’s own childhood in Alabama, "To Kill a Mockingbird" features one of literature’s towering symbols of integrity and righteousness in the character of Atticus Finch, based on Lee’s own father. The character of Scout, based on herself, has come to define youthful innocence – and its inevitable loss – for generation after generation of readers around the world.

shows.title: Betrayal
shows.synopsis: Direct from a standing-room-only hit run in London, Betrayal is the story of an illicit affair that unfolds in reverse—from the end of a marriage to the first forbidden spark. Starring Golden Globe and Olivier Award winner Tom Hiddleston (The Avengers), Zawe Ashton (Velvet Buzzsaw) and Charlie Cox (Daredevil), this stunning production features the daring vision of one of the UK’s most acclaimed directors.

shows.title: After Midnight
shows.synopsis: This exhilarating song and dance extravaganza is set to the swinging sounds of Duke Ellington, Jimmy McHugh, Dorothy Fields, Harold Arlen and more and framed by the poems of Langston Hughes.

shows.title: Twelfth Night
shows.synopsis: Join us to revel in the midsummer madness as twins Sebastian and Viola survive shipwreck, revenge plots, and the trick doors of love. The Public’s Associate Artistic Director and Resident Director, Tony Award nominee Saheem Ali directs this joyful romp welcoming all of New York back to the magic of Central Park’s beloved theater.

shows.title: 700 Sundays
shows.synopsis: "700 Sundays" is a poignant and heartwarming one-man show that invites audiences to explore the cherished memories of a man's life. Through the power of storytelling, this autobiographical play takes a deeply personal journey, delving into the formative moments that shaped his character and the relationships that defined his existence. Audiences are captivated as they witness the transformative experiences that have made him who he is, leaving an indelible mark on their own lives.

shows.title: A Gentleman's Guide to Love & Murder

creativeTeam.name: Robert L. Freedman and Steven Lutvak

shows.title: Macbeth
shows.synopsis: A terrifyingly prophetic tale of revenge, murder, and madness, Macbeth ominously traces the fallout when the darkest side of humanity cheats its way into a position of power. Often referred to as “The Scottish Play” by superstitious theatergoers due to the purported witchcraft found within its text, Macbeth is one of Shakespeare’s bloodiest, scariest, and yet, most popular tragedies.

shows.title: No Man's Land
shows.synopsis: Following their hit run on Broadway, Ian McKellen and Patrick Stewart return to the West End stage in Harold Pinter’s No Man's Land, broadcast live to cinemas from Wyndham’s Theatre, London.

shows.title: Beautiful The Carole King Musical
shows.synopsis: After 6 years and 2400 performances on Broadway, BEAUTIFUL, the Tony and Grammy Award-winning musical will play its final performance this October. Don’t miss your last chance to thrill to the inspiring true story of one woman’s remarkable journey from teenage songwriter to the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame.

creativeTeam.name: Gerry Goffin, Carole King, Barry Mann and Cynthia Weil
Gerry Goffin, Carole King, Barry Mann and Cynthia Weil

shows.title: Machinal
shows.synopsis: Inspired by the infamous 1926 case of Ruth Snyder, a woman sent to the electric chair for murdering her husband, Machinal follows this woman’s rebellion against a world of crushing conformity—where passion, desperation, and defiance collide in a shocking act of violence. Nearly a century after its debut, this play remains a strikingly relevant meditation on gender, power, and the oppression of “the machine.”

shows.title: Bronx Bombers
shows.synopsis: Based on the one-man show that inspired the now classic film, this streetwise musical will take you to the stoops of the Bronx in the 1960s—where a young man is caught between the father he loves and the mob boss he’d love to be. Featuring an original doo-wop score, this is a tale about respect, loyalty, love and above all else: family.

shows.title: The Bridges of Madison County
shows.synopsis: Fresh from their critically acclaimed run in The Bridges of Madison County, two time Tony Award® nominee Kate Baldwin (Hello, Dolly!, Big Fish, Finian’s Rainbow) and Broadway and television star Aaron Lazar (The Light in the Piazza, Fox’s “Filthy Rich,” The Last Ship) bring their “glorious soprano” and “soaring tenor” voices together in a brand new show at 54 Below! An “unstoppable pair” with “blazing chemistry,” Kate and Aaron perform songs from Bridges, reprising their turns as Francesca and R

shows.title: All The Way
shows.synopsis: Tony, Olivier, Emmy and Golden Globe-winner Bryan Cranston ("Breaking Bad," "All The Way") makes his triumphant return to Broadway in the National Theatre’s sold-out, critically acclaimed production of "Network."

shows.title: Rocky
shows.synopsis: Filled with fun, frolics and frocks, this is the show the Daily Telegraph calls “fresh, subversive, and essential.”

creativeTeam.name: Christopher Jahnke, Stephen Metcalfe and Stephen Brooker

shows.title: If/Then
shows.synopsis: In her first full concert return to 54 Below, Broadway veteran Janet Krupin (Bring It On, Hands on A Hardbody, If/Then) performs from a spectrum of stories that make life sparkle. Roles she played, roles that got away, and roles yet to be! From classics to modern hits, all the way to originals, Janet’s voice, and comedy chops, are sure to entertain. An audience favorite from the “Broadway Loves” series, Janet is thrilled to be coming home again to the underground musical jewelry box that is 54 B

creativeTeam.name: Harry DeCosta, Edwin Edwards, James D. LaRocca, W.H. Ragas, Anthony Sbarbaro and Larry Shields

shows.title: Lady Day at Emerson's Bar & Grill
shows.synopsis: MCC Theater’s annual Miscast gala is one of the most exciting and unique theater events in town. Broadway’s hottest stars perform songs from roles in which they would not traditionally be cast. And the results are thrilling!

shows.title: Of Mice and Men
shows.synopsis: In the dusty fields of 1930s California, two migrant workers, the towering Lennie and his quick-witted friend George, dream of a better life. When Lennie's innocent nature gets them into trouble, their bond is put to the ultimate test in a heartbreaking tale of friendship, desperation, and the pursuit of the American Dream. With powerful performances and a poignant exploration of isolation and the human condition, "Of Mice and Men" grips audiences with its timeless, thought-provoking narrative.

shows.title: Violet
shows.synopsis: In a “Freaky Friday” turn of events, current and former Broadway kids trade places! Growing Up Broadway presents Switched, where current Broadway kids sing the songs of roles that they need to wait a few years to take the stage with, while former Broadway “kids” sing the songs of the roles that they might be a bit too old to play. This is a show that the young theater lover (or the young at heart) can’t miss! Conceived and produced by (former Broadway kid) Dara Paige Bloomfield.

creativeTeam.name: Rick Bassett, Joseph Joubert and Buryl Red

shows.title: The Velocity of Autumn
shows.synopsis: In "The Velocity of Autumn," an elderly artist barricades herself in her Brooklyn brownstone, refusing to leave her home. As a standoff ensues with her estranged son, the play explores the powerful clash between a fierce desire for independence and the need for family connection. Through witty dialogue and poignant moments, the audience is drawn into the heart-wrenching journey of a woman fighting to maintain control over her own life.

shows.title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch
shows.synopsis: "Head Over Heels" is the bold and fierce new musical comedy from the visionaries that rocked Broadway with "Hedwig and the Angry Inch," "Avenue Q" and "Spring Awakening." Set to the iconic music of the 1980's all-female rock band The Go-Go's, it includes the hit songs “We Got the Beat,” “Our Lips Are Sealed,” “Vacation,” Belinda Carlisle's “Heaven is a Place on Earth,” and many more!

shows.title: Cabaret
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: Wilkommen. Bienvenue. Welcome. Life is beautiful at the Kit Kat Club, and you're invited to enter it.

shows.title: Harvey
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre

shows.title: Fela!
shows.synopsis: What will it take to get two dozen powerfully passionate, exceedingly complicated, and all-too-human individuals to settle their differences, while they hold the very future of a nation in their hands? This Tony Award-winning Best Musical is tuneful, witty, and constantly surprising, especially in this revolutionary new production from directors Jeffrey L. Page and Diane Paulus. You may never think about our country—who we are and why—the same way again.

creativeTeam.name: Bill T. Jones and Jim Lewis

shows.title: Bring It On The Musical
shows.synopsis: Shoba Narayan, star of Disney’s smash hit Aladdin on Broadway, as well as Hamilton, Wicked and The Great Comet, makes her return to Feinstein’s/54 Below. Featuring notable songs that shaped her career, as well as a few of her personal favorites.  The evening is sure to be an experience you won’t want to miss. Join us as we journey with Shoba through her past, present, and future with song. Music direction by Or Matias.

shows.title: Chaplin
shows.synopsis: Mark Cortale Presents: Jenn Colella, is the Tony Award nominated star of Come From Away, and star on Broadway of If/Then, Chaplin, High Fidelity and Urban Cowboy. She headlines a live concert hosted by Sirius XM star Seth Rudetsky on Sunday, June 20 at 3PM ET, with a one-time rebroadcast 8PM ET.

shows.title: An Enemy of the People
shows.synopsis: An Enemy of the People (original Norwegian title: En folkefiende) is an 1882 play by Norwegian playwright Henrik Ibsen that explores the conflict between personal integrity and societal norms. The play centers on Dr.

shows.title: Cyrano de Bergerac
shows.synopsis: McAvoy leads a superb ensemble in this “breathtakingly exciting” (Evening Standard) theatrical tour-de-force that captures timeless passion through spoken word, contemporary poetry, and raw physicality. Cyrano seduces in raps and rhymes, using his linguistic brilliance to help another man win the heart of his one true love—above all—championing his own unbridled love for words.

shows.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
shows.synopsis: "Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?" is a scintillating psychological drama that delves into the tumultuous marriage of Martha and George, a middle-aged couple who invite a younger couple over for a late-night drinking session. As the night progresses, layers of deceit, resentment, and deep-seated issues within their relationship are gradually peeled back, leading to a volatile and emotionally charged confrontation that challenges the very foundations of their lives.

shows.title: Annie
shows.synopsis: ANNIE is a heartwarming musical that for generations has reminded audiences that “the sun will come out tomorrow.” And now the best-loved musical of all time is set to return in a new production that celebrates family, optimism and the American spirit as the ultimate cure for the hard knocks life throws your way. The original production of ANNIE opened on Broadway on April 21, 1977 and went on to win seven Tony Awards including Best Musical (Charles Strouse), Best Book (Thomas Meehan) and Best S

shows.title: The Mystery of Edwin Drood
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre

shows.title: Scandalous
shows.synopsis: This October, for a strictly limited engagement, Tony Award® winner and Broadway legend André De Shields opens the doors of the House of the Redeemer (7 E 95th) to only his most devoted disciples for a decadent spectacle. Within an historic Upper East Side mansion rarely opened to the public, De Shields and his ensemble invite just 100 guests per night to a sumptuous evening of ritual and revelry inspired by Molière’s notorious deceiver, Tartuffe.

shows.title: The Anarchist
shows.synopsis: In the captivating play "The Anarchist," a former radical faces off against a parole board official in a high-stakes confrontation. As the two women engage in a tense, psychological battle, the audience is drawn into a thought-provoking exploration of power, redemption, and the consequences of past actions. With its gripping dialogue and nuanced character study, "The Anarchist" promises to leave theatergoers deeply engaged and contemplating the complexities of morality and justice.

shows.title: Assassins
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: A journey through the dark side of the American dream, Stephen Sondheim and John Weidman’s Tony-winning musical Assassins explores the lives of nine men and women who either killed (or tried to kill) one of the Presidents of the United States. From John Wilkes Booth to Lee Harvey Oswald and beyond, the stories of our country’s most successful and would-be assassins intersect in unexpected ways, creating a powerful, yet unnervingly funny look at some of the most shocking moments in US history.

shows.title: Golden Boy
shows.synopsis: Sign up to our mailing list to receive exclusive offers, new show ticket alerts and seasonal promotions. You can unsubscribe at any time.

creativeTeam.name: Peter John Still and Marc Salzberg

shows.title: The Other Place
shows.synopsis: The play won rave reviews in London, with The Guardian calling it “astonishing for its taut, riveting naturalism” and Financial Times saying it is "a brilliant compound of the ordinary and the eerie.” The show is co-produced by The Shed and the National Theatre, in association with A Zeldin Company, and follows The Shed's programming model to bring audiences new plays and international hits that showcase the greatest storytellers of our time who push theatre daringly forward.

shows.title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
Rodgers + Hammerstein's Cinderella
shows.synopsis: In this enchanting Rodgers + Hammerstein musical, a young woman named Ella dreams of a better life beyond her modest beginnings. When she meets a charming prince, their worlds collide, and they must navigate the challenges of class and societal expectations to find their happily ever after. With a magical score and a timeless tale of transformation, "Rodgers + Hammerstein's Cinderella" weaves a captivating story of love, courage, and the power of dreams.

creativeTeam.name: Bill Elliott, Doug Besterman and Larry Hochman

shows.title: Ann
shows.synopsis: Ireland has one of the most iconic literary histories and that tradition of excellence continues to this day. Selected Shorts celebrates a new generation of greatness with an evening of short fiction curated from a few of the many Irish writers publishing today. Colum McCann (Let the Great World Spin, Twist) leads us on this literary foray through the Emerald Isle.

shows.title: Vanya and Sonia and Masha and Spike
shows.synopsis: Kevin Kline makes his eagerly awaited return to Broadway in Noël Coward’s outrageously irresistible backstage comedy PRESENT LAUGHTER.

shows.title: Hands on a Hardbody
shows.synopsis: In her first full concert return to 54 Below, Broadway veteran Janet Krupin (Bring It On, Hands on A Hardbody, If/Then) performs from a spectrum of stories that make life sparkle. Roles she played, roles that got away, and roles yet to be! From classics to modern hits, all the way to originals, Janet’s voice, and comedy chops, are sure to entertain. An audience favorite from the “Broadway Loves” series, Janet is thrilled to be coming home again to the underground musical jewelry box that is 54 B

shows.title: Lucky Guy
shows.synopsis: Varla Jean Merman (aka Jeffery Roberson Loe) starred in the musical Lucky Guy opposite Leslie Jordan in New York at the Little Shubert Theatre, prompting The New York Times to rave, “If Carol Burnett and Harvey Korman had stood in front of the right pair of funhouse mirrors, they might have resembled Ms. Merman and Mr. Jordan in stature as well as comedic talent.”

shows.title: Kinky Boots
shows.synopsis: The boots are back! Kinky Boots will lift your spirits to high-heeled heights! Celebrated with six Tony® Awards, including Best Musical, a Grammy® Award for Best Musical Theatre Album, and London’s Olivier Award for Best Musical, this big-hearted musical hit will have you strutting out of the theater saying “Yeah!”

creativeTeam.name: Will Van Dyke and Jason Loffredo

shows.title: Matilda The Musical
shows.synopsis: MATILDA THE MUSICAL is more than a show, it’s a phenomenon. Based on the beloved novel by best-selling author Roald Dahl, MATILDA is the story of an extraordinary girl who dreams of a better life. Armed with a vivid imagination and a sharp mind, Matilda dares to take a stand and change her destiny.

shows.title: Motown The Musical
shows.synopsis: Coming back to New York City is 54 Below’s very own Nicole Vanessa Ortiz! After a highly acclaimed Paper Mill Playhouse debut as Disco Diva Deloris Van Cartier in Sister Act The Musical, Nicole Vanessa Ortiz is back onstage for the holidays! Known for her BroadwayWorld Award-nominated one-woman concert Becoming Her: A Diva’s Tribute and show-stealing turns in Off-Broadway productions like Spamilton and Smokey Joe’s Cafe, Nicole is back in town with a whole new live experience: The Disco Odyssey!

shows.title: The Nance
shows.synopsis: "The Nance" follows Chauncey, a burlesque performer who plays the flamboyant "nance" character on stage in 1930s New York. As Chauncey navigates the complex social and political landscape of the era, he must confront his own identity and the challenges of being a closeted gay man in a time of increasing intolerance. Blending comedy and drama, the play offers a poignant exploration of personal authenticity, societal prejudice, and the power of self-expression.

shows.title: The Assembled Parties
shows.synopsis: The Assembled Parties follows the Bascov family as they gather for a festive Christmas celebration in their lavish New York City apartment. Beneath the veneer of wealth and privilege, tensions and secrets simmer, threatening to upend their lives. As the family navigates the complexities of their relationships, a profound and poignant exploration of the human experience unfolds, inviting the audience to examine the true meaning of family and the power of resilience.

shows.title: The Testament of Mary
shows.synopsis: Catch the hit musical that’s been bringing crime, pizzazz, and all that jazz to Broadway since October 1996 — it would be a crime to miss it. Whitney Leavitt (

shows.title: The Trip to Bountiful
shows.synopsis: Tony®, Emmy, and Grammy nominee Vanessa Williams makes her thrilling Diamond Series debut with a spectacular concert that will include music from her catalog of chart-topping hit songs, beloved Broadway classics, and American Songbook standards.

shows.title: I'll Eat You Last: A Chat With Sue Mengers
shows.synopsis: In "I'll Eat You Last: A Chat With Sue Mengers," audiences are transported into the glamorous world of Hollywood's most legendary talent agent. As she entertains guests in her Beverly Hills home, the larger-than-life Sue Mengers regales them with captivating tales of her storied career, offering a rare glimpse into the cutthroat industry she navigated with unparalleled wit and tenacity. Through her compelling narrative, the play offers a captivating portrait of a trailblazing woman who redefined the power dynamics in Tinseltown.

shows.title: Pippin
shows.synopsis: The enchanting musical PIPPIN will swing into town with a dazzling new production that won 4 Drama Desk Awards and 4 Tony Awards in 2013, including Best Revival of a Musical.

shows.title: Master Class
shows.synopsis: Back by popular demand! Marilyn Maye makes a shining return to Broadway’s Living Room. A theatrical legend with the power to “melt the heart of the most hardened cynics” (The New York Times), Maye will show audiences why she’s been crowned Manhattan’s Queen of Cabaret.

shows.title: Hair
shows.synopsis: Join The Public as we celebrate the 50th Anniversary of HAIR: the American tribal love-rock musical!

shows.title: Follies
shows.synopsis: Stephen Sondheim’s legendary musical, captured live from the National Theatre in London, returns to cinemas.

shows.title: The Mountaintop
shows.synopsis: This new musical reveals a comeback story like no other, of a woman who dared to defy the bounds of racism, sexism and ageism to become the global Queen of Rock n’ Roll. TINA – THE TINA TURNER MUSICAL is a celebration of resilience and an inspiration of triumph over adversity.

shows.title: Talking Cure
shows.synopsis: A captivating exploration of the complexities of the human psyche, "Talking Cure" invites audiences on a thought-provoking journey through the lives of two patients seeking solace in the hands of a renowned psychoanalyst. As their sessions unfold, the boundaries between therapist and patient blur, revealing the profound interconnectedness of their struggles and the transformative power of the "talking cure."

shows.title: George is Dead
shows.synopsis: Iconic actor, comedian, writer, and director Elaine May returns to Broadway for the first time in 50 years in Academy Award winner Kenneth Lonergan’s acclaimed memory play, "The Waverly Gallery."

shows.title: Honeymoon Motel
shows.synopsis: In "Honeymoon Motel," a group of eccentric characters collide at a seedy motel, their lives intertwining in unexpected ways. As secrets and hidden agendas unravel, the guests navigate a web of love, lust, and betrayal, all while the motel's manager tries to keep the chaos at bay. With sharp wit and biting humor, this play takes the audience on a hilarious and unpredictable journey, exploring the complexities of human relationships in the most unconventional of settings.

shows.title: Chinglish
shows.synopsis: Cherry Lane Theatre’s Obie Award-winning new play series presents "The Opportunities of Extinction", starring Jennifer Lim (Broadway: Chinglish), Dominic Rains (TV: “Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.,” “General Hospital”), and Andrea Negrete. Written by Sam Chanse, directed by Ed Sylvanus Iskandar, mentored by Migdalia Cruz.

shows.title: Other Desert Cities
shows.synopsis: A searing and provocative world premiere by actor/writer Tim Blake Nelson, directed by Mark Wing-Davey.

shows.title: Godspell
shows.synopsis: What do Bat Boy, The Rocky Horror Show, and Be More Chill all seem to have in common? They’re perfectly CAMP. That’s right, we want to end this summer with a bang- and what better way to do that than with the campiest showdown of all the most eccentric Broadway bops!

shows.title: Venus in Fur
shows.synopsis: "Venus in Fur" is a tantalizing theatrical experience that delves into the captivating dynamic between a director and an audacious actress. As the two engage in a charged power struggle, the line between fantasy and reality blurs, unleashing a thrilling exploration of desire, dominance, and the complexities of the creative process. Audiences are swept into a captivating world where the pursuit of artistic vision collides with the intoxicating allure of submission, leaving them spellbound and eager to uncover the hidden depths of this gripping two-person drama.

shows.title: Private Lives
shows.synopsis: PRIVATE LIVES premiered on August 18, 1930 at the King’s Theatre in Edinburgh. The play debuted on Broadway at the Times Square Theatre on January 27, 1931. Private Lives is about Elyot and Amanda, once married and now honeymooning with new spouses at the same hotel. What happens when they meet in these new circumstances results in a sparkling roundelay that results in what critics and audiences consider Coward’s greatest comedy.

shows.title: Seminar
shows.synopsis:
The creator of the show, Eli Bauman, worked on Obama's 2008 campaign in Las Vegas.
About making the show, Bauman said in a statement, "If any buffoon with zero qualifications can become President, then why couldn't I, also a buffoon with zero qualifications, write my first musical?"
The play stars recording artists Shanice & T. J. Wilkins and Michelle and Barack Obama.
Mitch McConnell, Hillary Clinton, and Sarah Palin are all characters in the musical.

shows.title: The Visit
shows.synopsis: Join students from NYU Steinhardt‘s Vocal Performance program in Musical Theatre as they bring “Cloud 9” to the 54 Below stage! They are a collection of artists from all corners of the world that came to New York with the same dream and found each other while pursuing a Masters in Vocal Performance at NYU Steinhardt.

shows.title: Bonnie and Clyde
shows.synopsis: The infamous scheming masterminds captured a nation’s heart during the Great Depression. Decades on, Bonnie and Clyde continue to be celebrated in a gritty, tense musical that puts their lives centre stage.

shows.title: Stick Fly
shows.synopsis: Relatable, raw, and refreshingly fun, it’s a celebration of finding yourself, your purpose, and the people who lift you up. The music – a mix of Keys’ classics and new songs written exclusively for the show – and exhilarating choreography bring to life a story that speaks to you no matter where you’re from, where you’ve been, or where you’re going. Come experience where dreams begin:

shows.title: On a Clear Day You Can See Forever
Lysistrata Jones
shows.synopsis: In her first solo show since 2014, watch Patti get over pandemic-related social anxiety in real-time as she talks motherhood, mental health, and more in her signature comedic style. From “1776” to “1989,” there’s a bop for everyone in this set list, and special guests that may even be a surprise to Patti herself! No nudity, but possibly some light swearing, and a crap ton of fun.

creativeTeam.name: David C. Woolard and Thomas Charles LeGalley
William David Brohn and Christopher Jahnke
DuBose Heyward, Dorothy Heyward and Ira Gershwin

shows.title: The Road to Mecca
shows.synopsis: In the remote South African town of New Bethesda, an elderly recluse, Miss Helen, has transformed her home into a stunning personal art installation - a testament to her creative spirit and the freedom she fiercely guards. When a concerned friend and a conservative minister clash over Miss Helen's unorthodox ways, a profound battle for the right to self-expression unfolds, challenging long-held beliefs and the very nature of what it means to live a life of purpose.

shows.title: Wit
