shows.synopsis: First steps, falling in love, heartbreak...life is full of firsts. Join novelist and Selected Shorts host Meg Wolitzer for an evening of hilarious and poignant short stories about the dramatic moments in life where everything changes and nothing will ever quite be the same.

shows.title: Gore Vidal's The Best Man
shows.synopsis: In the midst of a contentious presidential race, two candidates vying for the nomination engage in a high-stakes battle of political maneuvering and personal revelations. As they navigate the treacherous waters of their party's convention, the candidates must confront their own ambitions, ethics, and the consequences of their actions, all while trying to secure the nomination. With sharp wit and compelling drama, "Gore Vidal's The Best Man" explores the complexities of power, integrity, and the political landscape.

shows.title: Evita
shows.synopsis: Do you know what Eva Perón, Princess Diana, and Jesus Christ all have in common? They probably never sang in real life. But that hasn’t stopped us from portraying them as belting, screlting, and ballading versions of themselves for centuries. History class is in session! Join us for a celebration of some of the most iconic portrayals of real people from history, culture, and politics, featuring selections from Evita, Lizzie, SIX, Diana, and more!

creativeTeam.name: Andrew Lloyd Webber and David Cullen

shows.title: Magic/Bird
shows.synopsis: "Magic/Bird" takes audiences on a thrilling journey through the competitive and often turbulent relationship between basketball legends Earvin "Magic" Johnson and Larry Bird. As these two rivals push each other to new heights on the court, their intense on-court battles give way to a surprising off-court friendship that transcends the game and reflects the shifting dynamics of race and culture in America during a pivotal era in sports history.

shows.title: Peter and the Starcatcher
shows.synopsis: This Tony-winning imaginative and musical play, based on the best-selling novels, upends the century-old story of how a miserable orphan boy becomes the legendary Peter Pan. From marauding pirates and jungle tyrants to unwilling comrades and unlikely heroes, Peter and the Starcatcher playfully explores the depths of greed and despair... and the bonds of friendship, duty and love.

shows.title: One Man, Two Guvnors
shows.synopsis: "The Nap" is the American premiere by the author of the rollicking, award-winning Broadway comedy "One Man, Two Guvnors…"

shows.title: A Streetcar Named Desire
shows.synopsis: Hot off two sold-out runs in London’s West End, this staggering revival of Tennessee Williams’s A Streetcar Named Desire stars Oscar nominee Paul Mescal (Gladiator II, Aftersun, All of Us Strangers) alongside Patsy Ferran (Living, God’s Own Country) and Anjana Vasan (Killing Eve, Black Mirror), arriving at BAM for a limited five-week run.

shows.title: Ghost The Musical
shows.synopsis: Step inside Andrew Lloyd Webber’s The Phantom of the Opera. Directed by Tony Award®–winner Diane Paulus, MASQUERADE is a bold new immersive production of the world’s most haunting love story. Journey through the Paris Opera House in an intimate group of only sixty guests and move through the music, the mystery, and the seduction of the Music of the Night.

creativeTeam.name: Bruce Joel Rubin, Dave Stewart and Glen Ballard

shows.title: Nice Work If You Can Get It
Don't Dress for Dinner
shows.synopsis: Step into the heart of Cuba, beyond the glitz of the Tropicana, to a place where blazing trumpets and sizzling guitars set the dance floor on fire. Here, the real sound of Havana is born—and one woman discovers the music that will change her life forever.

shows.title: Leap of Faith
shows.synopsis: Ages 13+. Parental advisory: this show contains explicit language. Children under 5 are not allowed in the theatre.

shows.title: Brief Encounter
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: Don’t miss this four-time Tony-nominated drama that sold out its entire London run. See Comer as Tessa, a successful young defense lawyer whose life turns upside down after an assault. When she takes her case to court — and finds it difficult to win — she suddenly sees her profession from the other side. See Comer in what London Theatre calls “an astonishing tour-de-force performance,” raving, “Comer herself makes this unmissable viewing.”

shows.title: The Pitmen Painters
shows.synopsis: "The Pitmen Painters" transports audiences to 1930s Northern England, where a group of coal miners embark on an unexpected artistic journey. Discovering a talent for painting, they challenge societal norms and explore the transformative power of art, navigating the complexities of class, education, and self-expression. Through captivating storytelling and vivid onstage depictions, the play offers a compelling exploration of the human spirit's ability to find expression in the most unexpected of circumstances.

shows.title: Mrs. Warren's Profession
shows.synopsis: Five-time Olivier Award winner Imelda Staunton (The Crown) joins forces with her real-life daughter Bessie Carter (Bridgerton) for the very first time, playing mother and daughter in Bernard Shaw’s incendiary moral classic.

shows.title: A Life in the Theatre
shows.synopsis: Tony Award winners Santino Fontana and BD Wong take the stage for a one-night-only reading of David Mamet’s hilarious play A Life in the Theatre. The balance of power shifts as two actors—one rising into the first flush of success, the other beginning to wane—play multiple roles and exchange backstage banter in Mamet's wildly entertaining love letter to the theater.

shows.title: Bloody Bloody Andrew Jackson
shows.synopsis: Maria-Christina Oliveras caught the attention of NYC theater fans with an explosive, show-stopping turn in David Byrne and Fatboy Slim’s multiple award-winning musical Here Lies Love. She now brings her gift of storytelling and unique style to Feinstein’s/54 Below in an electrifying night of music and surprises.

creativeTeam.name: Michael Friedman, Gabriel Kahane and Justin Levine

shows.title: La Bête
shows.synopsis: In the exuberant world of 17th-century France, a renowned playwright, Elomire, finds his rigid artistic principles challenged by the brash and bombastic Valere, a self-proclaimed genius who infiltrates the court. As the two engage in a battle of wits and egos, their clash of artistic visions threatens to upend the very fabric of the theatrical establishment. With biting wit and uproarious humor, "La Bête" delves into the timeless tensions between tradition and innovation, offering a delightful commentary on the nature of art and the human condition.

shows.title: Rain
shows.synopsis: Spring is coming, which means the Major Leagues are in Florida and gardeners everywhere are coaxing their seedlings to sprout. WNYC's Peabody Award–winning radio host Brian Lehrer takes a break from the pressing issues of the day to host a verdant evening of Selected Shorts dedicated to mystery gardens, the triumphs and heartbreaks of baseball, and love in bloom.

creativeTeam.name: John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison, Bert Berns and Phil Medley

shows.title: Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown
Colin Quinn: Long Story Short
shows.synopsis: Quinn is here to teach you how to be someone people want to talk to. He’s spent a lifetime chatting to friends, municipal workers, family, customer service workers — he knows what he’s (small) talking about. You’ll walk out knowing how not to drain the life from a conversation and actually show some charisma. How often can you say you left a comedy show smarter and friendlier than ever?

shows.title: The Pee-wee Herman Show
shows.synopsis: In the zany world of "The Pee-wee Herman Show," audiences join the iconic bow-tied eccentric on a whimsical adventure filled with quirky characters, offbeat humor, and imaginative set pieces. As Pee-wee navigates the colorful world of his Playhouse, he faces unexpected challenges and encounters a diverse array of friends, foes, and peculiar personalities, all while captivating audiences with his boundless energy and childlike wonder. This beloved stage production promises a delightfully surreal and uproariously entertaining theatrical experience for fans of Pee-wee Herman and newcomers alike.

shows.title: The Merchant of Venice
shows.synopsis: Ira Aldridge, the great Shakespearean who left America for Britain in 1824 due to racial discrimination, became in 1831 the first Black actor to play Shylock. Nearly 200 years after Aldridge starred in the role in Britain, Ireland and Europe, John Douglas Thompson will be the first Black actor to play Shylock at a professional theatre in New York City.

shows.title: Elling
shows.synopsis: William Finn and Rachel Sheinkin's winning, high-energy musical has been staged all over the country. Now, it returns to New York on the 20th anniversary of its Broadway bow. That premiere was an auspicious one, making stars of original cast members Celia Keenan-Bolger and Jesse Tyler Ferguson. The theatre legend James Lapine directed. Rachel Sheinkin won a Tony Award for her smart, engaging, and hilarious book.

shows.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
shows.synopsis: Three-time Olivier Award-winner Sharon D Clarke is joined by Ncuti Gatwa (Doctor Who; Sex Education) in this joyful reimagining of Oscar Wilde’s most celebrated comedy, a hilarious story of identity, impersonation, and romance, filmed live from the National Theatre in London.

shows.title: That Championship Season
shows.synopsis: That Championship Season is a 1972 play by Jason Miller. It was the recipient of the 1973 Pulitzer Prize for Drama and the 1973 Tony Award for Best Play.

shows.title: Arcadia
shows.synopsis: "Head Over Heels" is the bold and fierce new musical comedy from the visionaries that rocked Broadway with "Hedwig and the Angry Inch," "Avenue Q" and "Spring Awakening." Set to the iconic music of the 1980's all-female rock band The Go-Go's, it includes the hit songs “We Got the Beat,” “Our Lips Are Sealed,” “Vacation,” Belinda Carlisle's “Heaven is a Place on Earth,” and many more!

shows.title: Priscilla Queen of the Desert
shows.synopsis: J. Elaine Marcos, now starring in DRAG: The Musical and known for her roles in Annie, Priscilla, Queen of the Desert, and A Chorus Line, returns to 54 Below with What I Did For... A Job. Join J. Elaine as she shares her unique journey of booking 10 Broadway shows! Featuring music from A Chorus Line, Miss Saigon, Priscilla, Sweet Charity, and more. If you’ve ever auditioned for musicals, this show takes you behind the scenes and spills the Broadway tea.

shows.title: Ghetto Klown
shows.synopsis: In "Ghetto Klown," acclaimed comedian and actor John Leguizamo takes the stage in a hilarious and poignant one-man show that delves into his remarkable life journey. From his humble beginnings in the Bronx to his rise to stardom, Leguizamo captivates audiences with his raw, honest, and often hilarious storytelling, offering a unique glimpse into the challenges and triumphs that have defined his extraordinary career. With his signature wit and dynamic performance, Leguizamo invites the audience on a roller-coaster ride of laughter, reflection, and self-discovery.

shows.title: How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
shows.synopsis: TWO-TIME TONY AWARD® WINNER MATTHEW BRODERICK AND TWO-TIME EMMY AWARD® WINNER SARAH JESSICA PARKER are coming to the Broadway stage together for the first time in over 20 years. Headlining the classic comedy PLAZA SUITE, by legendary playwright and four-time Tony winner NEIL SIMON, these two world-class actors play three different couples in one famous hotel room.

creativeTeam.name: Abe Burrows, Jack Weinstock and Willie Gilbert

shows.title: Bengal Tiger at the Baghdad Zoo

creativeTeam.name: Acme Sound Partners and Cricket S. Myers

shows.title: Anything Goes
shows.synopsis: Last chance to embark on a great adventure! See the most Tony®-winning show of the 2023 season before April 28.

creativeTeam.name: P. G. Wodehouse, Guy Bolton, Howard Lindsay and Russel Crouse

shows.title: Catch Me If You Can
shows.synopsis: Catch Me If You Can is a musical drama with a libretto by Terrence McNally and a theatrical score by Marc Shaiman and Scott Wittman. It follows the story of a con artist named Frank Abagnale.

shows.title: The Motherfucker with the Hat
shows.synopsis: In this gritty, biting comedy, a man returns home to find another man's hat in his apartment, igniting a wild goose chase through the streets of New York as he confronts his girlfriend, his sponsor, and his best friend, all while struggling to maintain his newfound sobriety. With razor-sharp dialogue and relatable characters, "The Motherfucker with the Hat" takes a sharp-witted look at the complexities of love, addiction, and the bonds of friendship.

shows.title: War Horse
shows.synopsis: War Horse is a play based on the book of the same name by writer Michael Morpurgo, adapted for stage by Nick Stafford. Originally Morpurgo thought "they must be mad" to try to make a play from his best-selling 1982 novel; but the play was a great success.

shows.title: Wonderland
shows.synopsis: Join curious Alice as she encounters talking animals, mad tea parties, and the mysterious Queen of Hearts in a fantastical world brought to life through enchanting songs, colorful characters, and delightful surprises for all ages.

shows.title: The House of Blue Leaves
shows.synopsis: This is must-see theatre at its best, as these powerhouse actors lead this searing production about sparring, unlikely lovers. See these performers like you’ve never seen them before in a play The New York Times called “the equivalent of sitting at ringside watching a prize fight.”

creativeTeam.name: Joel Grey and George C. Wolfe

shows.title: The People in the Picture
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre

creativeTeam.name: Howell Binkley and James F. Ingalls

shows.title: Burn the Floor
shows.synopsis: "Burn the Floor" is a heart-pounding dance extravaganza that takes the stage by storm. Audiences are whisked away on a journey of passion and rhythm, as a troupe of world-class dancers push the boundaries of ballroom and Latin dance. With electrifying choreography, pulsating music, and captivating performances, "Burn the Floor" ignites the stage, leaving audiences breathless and craving for more.

shows.title: Superior Donuts
shows.synopsis: BUST OUT that record player and GROOVE ALONG to timeless ROCK N’ ROLL, SOUL, & FUNK top chart & Broadway hits!

shows.title: Wishful Drinking
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: In "Wishful Drinking," legendary actress Carrie Fisher takes the stage and delves into her extraordinary life, from growing up as the daughter of Hollywood royalty to navigating the complexities of addiction and mental health. With her signature wit and unflinching candor, she recounts the highs and lows of her remarkable journey, captivating audiences with her raw, honest, and often hilarious storytelling.

shows.title: Bye Bye Birdie
shows.synopsis: Celebrate the 95th birthday of Broadway legend Charles Strouse at 54 Below! The Tony Award-winning composer of shows including Annie, Bye Bye Birdie, and Applause will be celebrated in song by an illustrious cast. Come “put on a happy face” as we honor one of Broadway’s greatest composers on his birthday!

shows.title: Memphis
shows.synopsis: A hair-raising drama that reverberates with the “authentic and exciting pulse” (Ben Brantley, The New York Times) of mystery, Charles Fuller's Pulitzer Prize-winning masterpiece rockets onto Broadway for the first time, starring three-time Tony nominee David Alan Grier and Golden Globe nominee Blair Underwood and directed by Tony Award winner Kenny Leon (A Raisin in the Sun).

shows.title: Finian's Rainbow
shows.synopsis: Alice Childress’s Trouble in Mind offers a wry and moving look at racism, identity, and ego in the world of New York theatre.

creativeTeam.name: Robert Russell Bennett and Don Walker

shows.title: Irving Berlin's White Christmas
shows.synopsis: Mr. Berlin understood the impact dance had on the public and his melodies, rhythms, and lyrics reflected his love of that art form. Six spectacular performers will perform these magnificent songs and will also tell the stories behind the man who made the music that made the movies dance.

shows.title: Fela!
shows.synopsis: What will it take to get two dozen powerfully passionate, exceedingly complicated, and all-too-human individuals to settle their differences, while they hold the very future of a nation in their hands? This Tony Award-winning Best Musical is tuneful, witty, and constantly surprising, especially in this revolutionary new production from directors Jeffrey L. Page and Diane Paulus. You may never think about our country—who we are and why—the same way again.

creativeTeam.name: Jim Lewis and Bill T. Jones

shows.title: A Little Night Music
shows.synopsis: A Little Night Music is a musical with music and lyrics by  Stephen Sondheim and book by Hugh Wheeler. Inspired by the 1955 Ingmar Bergman film Smiles of a Summer Night, it involves the romantic lives of several couples.

creativeTeam.name: Dan Moses Schreier and Gareth Owen

shows.title: Present Laughter
shows.synopsis: Kevin Kline makes his eagerly awaited return to Broadway in Noël Coward’s outrageously irresistible backstage comedy PRESENT LAUGHTER.

shows.title: A View From the Bridge
shows.synopsis: A View from the Bridge is a play by American playwright Arthur Miller. It was first staged on September 29, 1955, as a one-act verse drama with A Memory of Two Mondays at the Coronet Theatre on Broadway.

shows.title: The Miracle Worker
shows.synopsis: "The Miracle Worker" follows the powerful true story of Helen Keller, a young girl who is deaf and blind, and her determined teacher, Annie Sullivan, as they engage in a life-changing battle of wills. Through their remarkable journey, Annie relentlessly works to break through Helen's isolation and teach her to communicate, leading to a profound transformation that inspires and captivates audiences. This gripping tale of perseverance and the human spirit unfolds on the stage, showcasing the incredible strength of the bond between teacher and student.

shows.title: A Behanding in Spokane
shows.synopsis: A mysterious stranger seeks a hand that was severed from his body decades ago. As he confronts a couple of shady con artists who claim to have the missing hand, a twisted game of deceit and violence unfolds, leading to a shocking and darkly comedic climax. With its offbeat characters and unsettling premise, "A Behanding in Spokane" promises a gripping theatrical experience that will leave audiences on the edge of their seats.

shows.title: Next Fall
shows.synopsis: Sheryl Kaller, the Tony-nominated original director of the show’s first Off-Broadway run, returns for this new production of the play, which The New York Times praised for its “delicate equilibrium between laugh-out-loud comedy and gasp-inducing, self-inflicted tragedy.”

shows.title: All About Me
shows.synopsis: From its initial run at Barrington Stage in 2022, director Ashley Brooke Monroe and original cast members Madison Ferris and Danny J. Gomez return alongside Kyra Sedgwick, Lily Mae Harrington, Florencia Lozano, Brian Morabito for this hilarious and candid portrayal of class and disability by Laura Winters.

shows.title: Come Fly Away
shows.synopsis: Welcome to Margaritaville, where people come to get away from it all—and stay to find something they never expected.

shows.title: Lend Me a Tenor
shows.synopsis: "Lend Me a Tenor" is a hilarious farce that takes place in a Cleveland hotel suite. When a famous Italian opera singer is unable to perform, a young assistant is tasked with impersonating him, leading to a night of mistaken identities, romantic hijinks, and side-splitting laughter. With a talented cast and a delightfully absurd plot, this Broadway production promises an evening of pure entertainment.

shows.title: The Addams Family
shows.synopsis: This is a New York moment. We've partnered with Tavern on the Green and Krysta Rodriguez to reunite the theatre community to celebrate Broadway’s opening. The show's happening smack dab in the heart of the city — with a drink in hand, of course!

shows.title: Million Dollar Quartet
shows.synopsis: Sign up to our mailing list to receive exclusive offers, new show ticket alerts and seasonal promotions. You can unsubscribe at any time.

shows.title: La Cage aux Folles
shows.synopsis: This Tony-winning musical comedy tells a story of love, family, and acceptance—and, of course, the greatest drag show on the French Riviera! Emmy, Grammy, and Tony winner Billy Porter (Pose, Encores! Jelly’s Last Jam) stars as the fabulous Albin in this heartfelt show from Lifetime Achievement Tony Award winners Harvey Fierstein and Jerry Herman. Directed by Robert O’Hara (A Raisin in the Sun, Encores! Jelly’s Last Jam), this production features an all-star, all-Black cast.

shows.title: American Idiot
shows.synopsis: Etheridge's illustrious career spans more than 30 years, but you've never seen or heard her like this. Don't miss this intimate solo show in which Etheridge, guitar in hand, takes audiences on a journey through the ups and downs of her life and career. Hear Etheridge combine tender storytelling with her catalog of folk-rock songs. From award-winning hits to lesser-known tunes, they make for an unforgettable night with Etheridge at the theatre.

creativeTeam.name: Billie Joe Armstrong and Michael Mayer

shows.title: Sondheim on Sondheim
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: Join Tony Award® winner Kristin Chenoweth and a remarkable roster of Roundabout favorites for a once-in-a-lifetime benefit concert celebrating our longtime leader Todd Haimes. With Tony® winner Warren Carlyle (Kiss Me, Kate! She Loves Me, and On the Twentieth Century) directing and choreographing a stageful of stars, singers, and dancers, our dear friend Kristin will lead a loving tribute to a true theatre hero.

shows.title: Everyday Rapture
shows.synopsis: Everyday Rapture follows the captivating journey of Sherie Rene Scott as she navigates the complexities of her Evangelical upbringing and her dreams of Broadway stardom. Blending personal anecdotes, pop culture references, and soaring musical numbers, the show takes the audience on a poignant and humorous exploration of identity, faith, and the pursuit of artistic fulfillment. With its unique blend of storytelling and performance, Everyday Rapture promises a truly unforgettable theatrical experience.

creativeTeam.name: Dick Scanlan and Sherie Rene Scott
Ashley Hanson, Kurt Eric Fischer and Brian Ronan
Ashley Hanson , Kurt Eric Fischer and Brian Ronan

shows.title: Cirque Dreams
shows.synopsis: Cirque Dreams Holidaze dazzles with a brilliantly breathtaking holiday spectacular for the whole family. As the original cirque holiday theatrical event, this annual tradition wraps a Broadway-style production around awe-inspiring contemporary circus arts. Guests will be on the edge of their seats as a cast of holiday characters come to life, captivating audiences while defying gravity. Broadway World exclaims, “Lose yourself for 90 minutes and go back to those wonderful dreams you had as a kid.

creativeTeam.name: Lenora Taylor, Santiago Rojo and Cirque Productions

shows.title: [title of show]
shows.synopsis: [title of show] is a one-act musical, with music and lyrics by Jeff Bowen and a book by Hunter Bell.  The show chronicles its own creation as an entry in the New York Musical Theatre Festival, and follows the struggles of the author and composer/lyricist and their two actress friends during the initial brief (three-week) creative period, along with subsequent events leading up to the show's production.

shows.title: A Tale of Two Cities
shows.synopsis: The story begins during The Panic of 1837 when banks were failing all over New York and corrupt banker Gideon Bloodgood is about to empty his bank and abscond. A dastardly deed occurs – witnessed by a lone clerk – and his bank is saved. Fast-forward 20 years to The Panic of 1857 and the chickens come home to roost. The Streets of New York is indeed a tale of two cities where power and wealth live alongside poverty and hunger. Sound familiar? Boucicault’s 19th Century world fits right into our 21

shows.title: A Man for All Seasons
shows.synopsis: As Sir Thomas More refuses to recognize Henry VIII’s divorce and ascendancy as Supreme Head of the new Church of England, A Man for All Seasons reveals the risk of speaking truth to power and the clash that follows when fierce political will collides with deep moral conviction.

shows.title: To Be Or Not To Be
shows.synopsis: Got High Anxiety over the winter? Well, Springtime with Mel Brooks is coming! Why not join us for a roll in the hay and a preview of History of the World Part II. Giddy up on your Blazing Saddles and join us for a night of hilarity! Seriously, bring 11 friends and we’ll have Twelve Chairs waiting for you. Remember this is a live cabaret and not a Silent Movie – so, screw To Be Or Not To Be, the question is will you be there?

shows.title: All My Sons
shows.synopsis: Three powerhouse stars. One theatrical masterpiece. The towering achievement of the Broadway season.

shows.title: Billy Elliot: The Musical
shows.synopsis: In a “Freaky Friday” turn of events, current and former Broadway kids trade places! Growing Up Broadway presents Switched, where current Broadway kids sing the songs of roles that they need to wait a few years to take the stage with, while former Broadway “kids” sing the songs of the roles that they might be a bit too old to play. This is a show that the young theater lover (or the young at heart) can’t miss! Conceived and produced by (former Broadway kid) Dara Paige Bloomfield.

shows.title: Dividing the Estate
shows.synopsis:
Once every decade or so, a great actor gives a performance that reminds us why we go to the theater. Last year, that actor was Glenda Jackson in Three Tall Women. Now, she’s back on Broadway, climbing the tallest mountain any actor can climb. Glenda Jackson is KING LEAR.
The Tony® and two-time Oscar® winner plays Lear for 19 weeks only in a new production directed by Sam Gold, leading a cast that includes Jayne Houdyshell (The Humans), Elizabeth Marvel (Other Desert Cities), Aisling O’Sullivan (

shows.title: Shrek The Musical
shows.synopsis: Marissa O'Donnell (SHREK the Musical) brings you "Broadway Does Paramore," an awesome night of energetic, alternative angst! Sing along with some of Broadway's hottest pop/rock voices. From the hardcore emo-pop fan favorite “Misery Business" to the heart wrenching “The Only Exception," you're in for a night to remember with "Broadway Rocks Paramore" at The Green Room 42! Join us for a bad-ass night jamming to other favorites "That’s What You Get," "crushcrushcrush” and “Still Into You."

shows.title: Pal Joey
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: Step back into 1937 New York, where shipping clerk Harry Bogen has much bigger ambitions for himself. And he'll deceive, cheat, and backstab — even his loved ones — to make them happen. If cou can't put a price on dreams or community, how much will you do to keep either one?

shows.title: The American Plan
shows.synopsis: Baseball season may have ended, but you can still take yourself out to a ball game! Catch Williams’s grand-slam performance as Darren Lemming, the fictional star center fielder for the Empires. He’s knocking his career out of the park — until he comes out as gay, turning his relationship with his team, the public, and baseball itself upside down.

creativeTeam.name: Darron L. West and Bray Poor

shows.title: Hedda Gabler
shows.synopsis: “Inarguably one of the greatest dramas in the history of the American theater” (Chicago Tribune), Eugene O'Neill’s LONG DAY’S JOURNEY INTO NIGHT receives a vibrant and timely update in this interpretation by prolific, Tony Award®-nominated director Robert O’Hara (Slave Play).

shows.title: The Story of My Life
shows.synopsis: The Story of My Life is a musical with music and lyrics by Neil Bartram, and a book by Brian Hill.  The show follows two childhood friends from age six to 35 and has only two characters.

shows.title: 33 Variations
shows.synopsis: In "33 Variations," a modern-day musicologist, Katherine, becomes obsessed with Beethoven's mysterious fascination with a seemingly simple waltz. As she delves into the composer's creative process, the play intertwines her own struggles with a debilitating illness, unraveling the parallels between her life and Beethoven's. This captivating drama explores the power of artistic passion and the human drive to understand the unknown, drawing audiences into a poignant exploration of the creative spirit.

creativeTeam.name: Leonard Bernstein, Sid Ramin and Irwin Kostal

shows.title: Impressionism
shows.synopsis: For a limited time only, you can go on a 360-degree experiential journey through the history and works of one of the greatest and most influential painters of all time. Using state-of-the-art multimedia and multi-sensory technology, you can dive into the father of Impressionism’s paintings and get a glimpse into the inner workings of his mind as you bathe in gigantic water lilies in the very way monet wanted you to, completely immersed in his works.

shows.title: Exit the King
shows.synopsis: Now, he pairs up with New York Theatre Workshop Artistic Director Patricia McGregor on this new, biographical play. McGregor directs the New York premiere, which follows, on the night of his final broadcast, Nat deciding whether to quietly leave the limelight, or, as his friend Sammy Davis Jr. suggests, “go out with a bang.”

shows.title: Irena's Vow
shows.synopsis: Irena's Vow tells the inspiring true story of a Polish Catholic woman who risks her life to shelter a Jewish family during the Nazi occupation of Poland. As the war rages on, Irena must navigate the dangerous and morally complex terrain of safeguarding her charges, testing the limits of her courage and her humanity in the face of unimaginable evil.

shows.title: Reasons To Be Pretty
shows.synopsis: Tony Award winner Blair Brown (Copenhagen, Orange Is the New Black), four-time Emmy Award winner Edie Falco (The Sopranos, Frankie and Johnny…), and Tony Award nominee Marin Ireland (Reasons to Be Pretty) form a powerhouse trio of stars in this deeply felt, gorgeously imagined new play by Tony Award winner Simon Stephens (Heisenberg, The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time).

shows.title: Next To Normal
shows.synopsis: From the Donmar Warehouse, Next to Normal is an intimate exploration of family and illness, loss and grief, featuring a thrilling rock score from composer Tom Kitt with book and lyrics by Brian Yorkey. At its heart is Diana—played by Olivier and GRAMMY Award nominee Caissie Levy—a suburban wife and mother living with bipolar disorder and haunted by her past.

shows.title: Mary Stuart
shows.synopsis: Take a prime seat in the court of public opinion and watch the doctor’s case unfold, with her career and reputation on the line. What will your verdict be?

shows.title: Desire Under the Elms
shows.synopsis: In the captivating drama "Desire Under the Elms," a family's dark secrets and passionate desires collide, igniting a explosive conflict. As an estranged father returns home, his young bride and son engage in a dangerous game of manipulation, uncovering the deep-rooted tensions that threaten to tear the family apart. This gripping tale of love, betrayal, and the consequences of unbridled emotions unfolds on the stage, captivating audiences with its raw emotional intensity.

shows.title: Accent on Youth
shows.synopsis: "Accent on Youth" follows the life of a brilliant but aging playwright who falls for his much younger secretary. As he navigates the complexities of their relationship, he must confront his own insecurities and the changing tides of the theater world. This witty and poignant play explores the universal themes of love, creativity, and the pursuit of youthful vitality in a rapidly evolving world.

shows.title: 9 to 5
shows.synopsis: No one is more excited than Dolly Parton herself for this musical to come to Broadway. “I lived my whole life to see this show on stage," Parton said. "I’ve written many original songs for the show and included all your favorites in it as well. You’ll laugh, you’ll cry, you’ll clap, you’ll stomp, it truly is a Grand Ol’ Opera. Pun and fun intended. Don’t miss it!”

shows.title: Waiting for Godot
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre

creativeTeam.name: T. Richard Fitzgerald and Carl Casella

shows.title: Grease
shows.synopsis: Don’t Vape! The Grease Parody is the show formally known as Vape! The Grease Parody, a hilarious send-up of the iconic and timeless musical Grease. The show pokes loving fun at all the wonderful moments, sexual innuendos, outrageous characters, rivalries and secret romances from the original, while taking a satirical look at the state of youth culture today, which may have evolved, but never really changes.

shows.title: The Ritz
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: In the vibrant world of 1970s New York, a down-on-his-luck Manhattanite stumbles into a bathhouse, expecting a simple escape. Instead, he finds himself embroiled in a hilarious case of mistaken identity, entangled with a flamboyant mobster and a bevy of colorful characters. As he navigates this unexpected adventure, he discovers the power of self-acceptance and the joy of embracing the unexpected.

shows.title: Pygmalion
shows.synopsis: Don’t miss Lerner & Loewe’s MY FAIR LADY at Lincoln Center Theater, now playing through July 7 only! Directed by Tony® winner Bartlett Sher, this “enchanting and incandescent” (The Washington Post) revival was named the best Broadway musical of 2018 by The New York Times, Entertainment Weekly and Time Magazine. NY1 raves, “it reminds you how indispensable great theater can be.” The New York Times calls it “thrilling, glorious and better than it ever was.”

shows.title: A Bronx Tale
shows.synopsis: Based on the one-man show that inspired the now classic film, this streetwise musical will take you to the stoops of the Bronx in the 1960s—where a young man is caught between the father he loves and the mob boss he’d love to be. Featuring an original doo-wop score, this is a tale about respect, loyalty, love and above all else: family.

shows.title: Cyrano de Bergerac
shows.synopsis: McAvoy leads a superb ensemble in this “breathtakingly exciting” (Evening Standard) theatrical tour-de-force that captures timeless passion through spoken word, contemporary poetry, and raw physicality. Cyrano seduces in raps and rhymes, using his linguistic brilliance to help another man win the heart of his one true love—above all—championing his own unbridled love for words.

shows.title: Rock 'n' Roll
shows.synopsis: Filled with fun, frolics and frocks, this is the show the Daily Telegraph calls “fresh, subversive, and essential.”

shows.title: Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas!
shows.synopsis: You’ll find your heart growing a few sizes when you watch Dr. Seuss’ whimsical holiday classic come to life on stage! Inspired by the original children’s book and featuring hit songs “You’re A Mean One, Mr. Grinch” and “Welcome Christmas,” the Grinch, his sidekick Max and Cindy Lou Who help remind us of the true meaning of the holiday season. See Dr. Seuss’ How The Grinch Stole Christmas! The Musical at the Hulu Theater at Madison Square Garden, December 13-30.

creativeTeam.name: Tony Smolenski IV and Walter Trarbach

shows.title: The Farnsworth Invention
shows.synopsis: A terrifyingly prophetic tale of revenge, murder, and madness, Macbeth ominously traces the fallout when the darkest side of humanity cheats its way into a position of power. Often referred to as “The Scottish Play” by superstitious theatergoers due to the purported witchcraft found within its text, Macbeth is one of Shakespeare’s bloodiest, scariest, and yet, most popular tragedies.

creativeTeam.name: Walter Trarbach and Tony Smolenski IV

shows.title: The Seafarer
shows.synopsis: After losing yet another job, Sharky has returned home to Dublin to build a new, sober existence with his cantankerous elder brother, Richard, recently blinded in a drunken accident. But it’s Christmas Eve, and the drinks are flowing as old friends convene for an annual game of poker. This year, an immortal stranger from Sharky’s past arrives, raising the stakes to eternal consequence.

shows.title: Is He Dead?
shows.synopsis: Is He Dead? is a play by Mark Twain based on his earlier 1893 short story. The play, written by Twain in 1898, was first published in print in 2003 after Mark Twain scholar Shelley Fisher Fishkin read the manuscript in the archives of the Mark Twain Papers at the University of California at Berkeley.

shows.title: The Homecoming
shows.synopsis: Sign up to our mailing list to receive exclusive offers, new show ticket alerts and seasonal promotions. You can unsubscribe at any time.

shows.title: The Little Mermaid
shows.synopsis: Based on one of Hans Christian Andersen’s most beloved stories and the classic animated film, Disney’s The Little Mermaid is a hauntingly beautiful love story for the ages.

shows.title: The 39 Steps
shows.synopsis: When her ship is wrecked, Viola washes ashore in the unfamiliar land of Illyria and embarks on a journey to find her lost brother. Brimming with music, love and longing, William Shakespeare’s enchanting play will transport audiences to a world of comedic mayhem, mistaken identity and unrequited passion, where nothing is as it seems and anything is possible. Tony nominee Maria Aitken (The 39 Steps) leads alumni of The Acting Company and ensemble members of Delaware's Resident Ensemble Players (RE

shows.title: Come Back, Little Sheba
shows.synopsis: In "Come Back, Little Sheba," a middle-aged couple's quiet lives are upended when a young, attractive boarder moves in. As tensions rise and secrets are uncovered, the couple confronts the realities of their unfulfilled dreams and the consequences of their past choices. This poignant drama explores the complex dynamics of relationships, the power of desire, and the pursuit of happiness in the face of life's disappointments.

shows.title: Sunday in the Park with George
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: Jake Gyllenhaal makes his Broadway musical debut alongside Tony winner Annaleigh Ashford in the Stephen Sondheim/James Lapine Pulitzer Prize-winning masterpiece SUNDAY IN THE PARK WITH GEORGE. The three-night only production at City Center was one of the most rapturously acclaimed theatrical events of the season, and now it is headed to Broadway to open the highly-anticipated new Hudson Theatre where it will play a strictly limited engagement for 10 weeks only.

shows.title: Passing Strange
shows.synopsis: Now, he pairs up with New York Theatre Workshop Artistic Director Patricia McGregor on this new, biographical play. McGregor directs the New York premiere, which follows, on the night of his final broadcast, Nat deciding whether to quietly leave the limelight, or, as his friend Sammy Davis Jr. suggests, “go out with a bang.”

shows.title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
Gypsy
shows.synopsis: Celebrated for her stellar voice and varied, dynamic performances, the six-time Tony, two-time Grammy, and Emmy winner McDonald is not to be missed. Featuring a majority-Black main cast and creative team for the first time in the show's history — including multi-Tony-winning director George C. Wolfe and four-time Tony-nominated choreographer Camille A. Brown (

creativeTeam.name: Oscar Hammerstein II and Joshua Logan

shows.title: Macbeth
shows.synopsis: This spring, DANIEL CRAIG (No Time to Die, A Steady Rain) makes his much-anticipated return to Broadway alongside RUTH NEGGA (Passing, Hamlet), making her Broadway debut, in this world premiere production of Shakespeare’s heart-racing drama MACBETH, directed by Tony Award® winner SAM GOLD (Hamlet, Othello, Fun Home).

shows.title: A Catered Affair
shows.synopsis: SiriusXM Broadway host Seth Rudetsky is bringing back his acclaimed concert series every Sunday with his favorite Broadway stars! Those who have seen Seth’s concert series know that there is nothing else like them. Even if you’ve seen one of the stars in concert before, this is guaranteed to be different because these concerts are never fully planned. Often the stars themselves don’t know what songs they’re going to be singing!

shows.title: Cry-Baby
shows.synopsis: What do Bat Boy, The Rocky Horror Show, and Be More Chill all seem to have in common? They’re perfectly CAMP. That’s right, we want to end this summer with a bang- and what better way to do that than with the campiest showdown of all the most eccentric Broadway bops!

shows.title: The Country Girl
shows.synopsis: Playwright Conor McPherson reimagines the songs of the legendary Bob Dylan in GIRL FROM THE NORTH COUNTRY — the soaring masterwork about the dreams we keep close and the people we hold dear.

shows.title: Thurgood
shows.synopsis: Tony Award® winner, Emmy Award® winner, and Oscar® nominee Laurence Fishburne is both the star and the playwright of this one-man tour de force which he describes as “the stories and lies people have told me. And that I have told myself.”

shows.title: Les Liaisons Dangereuses
shows.synopsis: Hugo Marchand’s undeniable virtuosity, lyricism, charisma, and artistry have catapulted him to the height of ballet excellence. He is perhaps the most famous male Étoile in the Paris Opera Ballet—the highest rank in the most prestigious ballet company in the world. He is the curator and lead performer of City Center’s fifth Artists at the Center program, the most ambitious to date.

shows.title: Boeing-Boeing
shows.synopsis: Bernard is a swinging bachelor in 1960s Paris juggling three flight attendant fiancées, each unaware of the others. When his friend Robert visits, the delicate balance of Bernard's carefully orchestrated love life begins to unravel in hilarious fashion, as the women's flight schedules start to overlap and the plot twists and turns in this fast-paced, door-slamming comedy.

shows.title: Martin Short: Fame Becomes Me
shows.synopsis: Martin Hayter Short  (born March 26, 1950) is a Canadian comedian, actor and writer. Short is known as an energetic comedian who gained prominence for his roles in sketch comedy.

creativeTeam.name: Jonathan Tunick, Bill Byers and Hershy Kay

shows.title: Heartbreak House
shows.synopsis: In the eccentric Heartbreak House, a diverse group of aristocrats, artists, and eccentrics gather, each harbouring their own secrets and desires. As they engage in a delightful dance of wit, romance, and social commentary, the impending threat of war looms, forcing them to confront the fragility of their privileged existence. Filled with Shavian wisdom and biting humor, this captivating play by George Bernard Shaw examines the human condition with piercing insight and unforgettable charm.

shows.title: The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas
shows.synopsis: "The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas" is a raucous musical that takes audiences on a wild ride through the colorful world of a small-town brothel. As the local sheriff and a TV reporter clash over the fate of the legendary establishment, the larger-than-life personalities of the "working girls" captivate with their sassy showmanship and heart-wrenching personal stories. With a toe-tapping score and a cast of unforgettable characters, this unapologetic tale of vice and virtue unfolds with equal parts humor and poignancy.

creativeTeam.name: Larry L. King and Peter Masterson

shows.title: Butley
shows.synopsis: "Butley" is a captivating play that takes the audience on a rollercoaster journey through the life of a literature professor, Butley, as he navigates the complexities of his personal and professional relationships. Caught in a web of infidelity, betrayal, and self-discovery, Butley must confront his own demons and the consequences of his actions, all while delivering a sharp-witted and darkly humorous performance that keeps the audience on the edge of their seats.

shows.title: The Times They Are A-Changin'
shows.synopsis: "The Times They Are A-Changin'" transports audiences to the tumultuous 1960s, where a group of young revolutionaries challenge the status quo and fight for a better future. With a captivating original score and a talented ensemble, the musical takes a deep dive into the social and political upheaval of the era, exploring the power of activism, the struggle for civil rights, and the relentless pursuit of change. Audiences are immersed in a world where the only constant is the undeniable force of progress.

shows.title: Grey Gardens
shows.synopsis: "A Grey Gardens Christmas" goes beyond a simple play with music; it's a celebration of the enduring partnership between Peter and John, both in their personal life and their artistic collaboration. This production promises an unforgettable evening that marries performance art with emotional truth.

creativeTeam.name: Jon Weston, Andrew Bruce and Autograph

shows.title: The Little Dog Laughed
shows.synopsis: "The Little Dog Laughed" is a witty, modern play that explores the complexities of fame, sexuality, and the entertainment industry. When a rising Hollywood star's secret relationship with a male escort threatens to derail his career, his conniving agent and the escort's girlfriend are forced to confront their own desires and the consequences of their choices. With sharp dialogue and unexpected twists, the play delves into the power dynamics that shape both personal and professional lives in the pursuit of success.

shows.title: Mary Poppins
shows.synopsis: Discover the supercalifragilisticexpialidocious story of a magical, common-sensical nanny who arrives at one family’s home and opens their eyes to a world of adventure right under our noses.

creativeTeam.name: Richard M. Sherman and Robert B. Sherman

shows.title: Company
shows.synopsis: Trade in the dull gray of the concrete jungle for the glamour of 19th-century Paris. Be immersed in a world inspired by the Belle Époque, a period in which the arts flourished and spirits were high.

shows.title: The Vertical Hour
shows.synopsis: In "The Vertical Hour," a former war correspondent, Nadia Blye, finds her personal and political beliefs challenged when she meets a British doctor in the English countryside. As their passionate debate on the Iraq War unfolds, the boundaries between the personal and the political become increasingly blurred, leading to a thought-provoking exploration of the complexities of morality, loyalty, and the consequences of our choices.

shows.title: High Fidelity
shows.synopsis: Sometimes Broadway musicals run forever, like Cats or Les Misérables. But sometimes, Broadway musicals run for only a minute, like Merrily We Roll Along, High Fidelity, or Via Galactica. This is their story.

shows.title: The Apple Tree
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre

shows.title: Journey's End
shows.synopsis: As Sir Thomas More refuses to recognize Henry VIII’s divorce and ascendancy as Supreme Head of the new Church of England, A Man for All Seasons reveals the risk of speaking truth to power and the clash that follows when fierce political will collides with deep moral conviction.

shows.title: Prelude to a Kiss
shows.synopsis: In "Prelude to a Kiss," a chance encounter between a young bride and an elderly stranger leads to a supernatural body swap. As the newlyweds grapple with the mystical transformation, they must confront the complexities of love, identity, and the true meaning of commitment. This enchanting play explores the delicate balance between the physical and the spiritual, challenging audiences to question the nature of human connection.

shows.title: Talk Radio
shows.synopsis: Mark Cortale Presents: Christine Pedi, star of Broadway’s Chicago, Talk Radio and Little Me and daily host of SiriusXM Radio’s On Broadway channel, in a live concert hosted by Sirius XM star Seth Rudetsky on Sunday, May 9 at 3PM ET, with a one-time rebroadcast 8PM ET.

shows.title: The Year of Magical Thinking
shows.synopsis: Adventure runs in the family. When Harry Potter’s head-strong son Albus befriends the son of his fiercest rival, Draco Malfoy, it sparks an unbelievable new journey for them all—with the power to change the past and future forever. Prepare for a mind-blowing race through time, spectacular spells, and an epic battle, all brought to life with the most astonishing theatrical magic ever seen on stage. “You’ll be wondering ‘how’d they do that?’ for days to come” (People Magazine).

creativeTeam.name: Alain Boublil, Claude-Michel Schönberg and Richard Maltby, Jr
Alain Boublil, Richard Maltby, Jr. and John Dempsey

shows.title: A Moon for the Misbegotten
shows.synopsis: By turns hilarious and heartbreaking, Walking with Ghosts is a delightful portrait of the people and landscapes that ultimately shape our destinies. A Landmark production, it comes to Broadway direct from wildly successful runs in London’s West End; Edinburgh, Scotland; and Dublin, Ireland.

shows.title: Inherit the Wind
shows.synopsis: "Inherit the Wind" is a gripping courtroom drama that delves into the clash between science and religion. As a small town is rocked by a controversial trial over the teaching of evolution, two powerful attorneys engage in a battle of wits and ideologies, igniting a fierce debate that challenges the very foundations of beliefs. With compelling characters and a thought-provoking narrative, the play explores the timeless struggle between progress and tradition, inviting audiences to examine the limits of freedom and the pursuit of truth.

shows.title: Lovemusik
shows.synopsis: Sometimes Broadway musicals run forever, like Cats or Les Misérables. But sometimes, Broadway musicals run for only a minute, like Merrily We Roll Along, High Fidelity, or Via Galactica. This is their story.

shows.title: Deuce
shows.synopsis: On October 21, stars from Broadway, film and TV will gather to write, rehearse and perform new plays in 24 hours! Extraordinary artists race the clock, forge enduring creative partnerships and leave everything on the stage in a singular evening of live theater. Be in the room where it happens for Broadway's can't miss theatrical high-wire act!

shows.title: Radio Golf
shows.synopsis: Tensions rise in the heart of Pittsburgh's historic Hill District as successful African-American real estate developer Harmond Wilks navigates the complexities of gentrification and his family's legacy. Caught between his ambitions for the future and the ghosts of the past, Harmond must confront the ethical dilemmas that threaten to unravel his carefully constructed world. "Radio Golf" is a powerful exploration of race, progress, and the enduring impact of history on the present.

shows.title: 110 in the Shade
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre

shows.title: After the Night and the Music
shows.synopsis: After the Night and the Music is a one-act play in three parts, written by Elaine May. It opened in 2005. May derived the name of the play from the Howard Dietz song "You and the Night and the Music".

creativeTeam.name: David Van Tieghem and Jill B.C. Du Boff

shows.title: Lennon
shows.synopsis: Theatre Within, in association with Music Without Borders, presents the 42nd Annual John Lennon Tribute charity concert, a joyful celebration of John Lennon’s life, music and timeless message of peace and love.

shows.title: On the Twentieth Century
shows.synopsis: Join Tony Award® winner Kristin Chenoweth and a remarkable roster of Roundabout favorites for a once-in-a-lifetime benefit concert celebrating our longtime leader Todd Haimes. With Tony® winner Warren Carlyle (Kiss Me, Kate! She Loves Me, and On the Twentieth Century) directing and choreographing a stageful of stars, singers, and dancers, our dear friend Kristin will lead a loving tribute to a true theatre hero.

shows.title: A Naked Girl on the Appian Way
shows.synopsis: "A Naked Girl on the Appian Way" takes audiences on a thrilling journey into the lives of a seemingly ordinary suburban family whose world is turned upside down when a mysterious naked woman appears on their doorstep. As they grapple with the shocking revelation and its unexpected consequences, the family is forced to confront their deepest secrets and the fragility of their relationships, leading to a gripping and emotionally charged theatrical experience.

shows.title: Latinologues
shows.synopsis: "Latinologues" is a captivating exploration of the diverse Latino experience in America. Through a series of interconnected vignettes, the play delves into the joys, challenges, and complexities of navigating cultural identities, family dynamics, and personal struggles. Featuring a talented ensemble of actors, the production offers a powerful and authentic representation of the Latino community, inviting audiences to engage with stories that are both relatable and thought-provoking.

shows.title: Jersey Boys
shows.synopsis: JERSEY BOYS is the behind-the-music story of Frankie Valli and The Four Seasons. They were just four guys from Jersey, until they sang their very first note. They had a sound nobody had ever heard… and the radio just couldn’t get enough of. But while their harmonies were perfect on stage, off stage it was a very different story -- a story that has made them an international sensation all over again.

shows.title: The Woman in White
shows.synopsis: Welcome to Allwhite, a soap opera town where the white characters live out the juiciest, most thrilling drama and Black characters stay in the “Blackground.” One day, Blackground character Keesha steps forward and hijacks the white stories – but that makes her the target of a killer.

shows.title: Seascape
shows.synopsis: In Edward Albee's Seascape, a couple's tranquil beach vacation is upended when they encounter a pair of mysterious, humanoid sea creatures. As the two couples navigate their unexpected encounter, they grapple with questions of evolution, communication, and the very nature of humanity. Blending wry humor and profound insights, Seascape explores the boundaries between the familiar and the unfamiliar, inviting audiences to consider their place in the grand tapestry of life.

creativeTeam.name: Brenda Russell, Allee Willis and Stephen Bray
Brenda Russell, Allee Willis and Stephen Bray

shows.title: A Touch of the Poet
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: By turns hilarious and heartbreaking, Walking with Ghosts is a delightful portrait of the people and landscapes that ultimately shape our destinies. A Landmark production, it comes to Broadway direct from wildly successful runs in London’s West End; Edinburgh, Scotland; and Dublin, Ireland.

shows.title: Chita Rivera: The Dancer's Life
shows.synopsis: Daniele, an award-winning performer, choreographer, and director, dramatizes her remarkable life and career as the story of Anuncia, a woman raised in 1940s Argentina under the Perón regime. Decades later, as she tends her garden, she reflects on the women who made sacrifices and gave her the support that allowed her dreams as a theatre artist to blossom.

shows.title: A Wonderful Life
shows.synopsis: It’s 1981 in America, and Trevor Nelson is busy navigating adolescence in suburbia while dreaming of a life in show business. When an embarrassing incident at school suddenly puts him in the wrong spotlight, Trevor must summon the courage to forge his own path.

shows.title: Bridge & Tunnel
shows.synopsis: SiriusXM Broadway host Seth Rudetsky is bringing back his acclaimed concert series every Sunday with his favorite Broadway stars! Those who have seen Seth’s concert series know that there is nothing else like them. Even if you’ve seen one of the stars in concert before, this is guaranteed to be different because these concerts are never fully planned. Often the stars themselves don’t know what songs they’re going to be singing!

shows.title: Rabbit Hole
shows.synopsis: Public radio's hit show Radiolab is on a curiosity bender, and Selected Shorts is here to help! They ask deep questions and use investigative journalism to get the answers; we present great short fiction read by great actors. Join Radiolab hosts Lulu Miller and Latif Nasser as we team up for an evening of mind-bending, fantastical stories.

shows.title: Barefoot in the Park
shows.synopsis: "Barefoot in the Park" is a delightful romantic comedy that follows the newlywed couple, Corie and Paul, as they navigate the challenges of adjusting to their first home, a tiny New York City apartment. With Corie's free-spirited nature clashing with Paul's cautious sensibilities, the pair must learn to compromise and embrace the unexpected joys of married life. As they encounter an array of colorful characters, including Corie's eccentric mother and their quirky neighbor, the young couple's love is put to the test in this charming and heartwarming tale.

shows.title: Ring of Fire
shows.synopsis: The Ziegfeld Follies, George White’s Scandals, The Jersey Boys, Beautiful, All Shook Up, Kismet, After Midnight, Ring of Fire, and more!

shows.title: Well
shows.synopsis: Set in a small Midwestern town, Well, I'll Let You Go is a portrait of a woman and a community in crisis. Alternately vast and personal in scope, shifting backwards and forwards in time, this expansive, yet incredibly intimate, debut play sifts through the rubble of a town, a marriage, and a life built on an American Dream that’s crumbled.

creativeTeam.name: Peter John Still and Marc Salzberg

shows.title: Three Days of Rain
shows.synopsis: Baseball season may have ended, but you can still take yourself out to a ball game! Catch Williams’s grand-slam performance as Darren Lemming, the fictional star center fielder for the Empires. He’s knocking his career out of the park — until he comes out as gay, turning his relationship with his team, the public, and baseball itself upside down.

shows.title: The Threepenny Opera
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: Back for an encore by popular demand after a sold out show last summer! Join us at 54 as we celebrate Jerry Orbach, the beloved performer who started out Off-Broadway in The Threepenny Opera and The Fantasticks, then went on to become a leading man in such Broadway shows as Carnival, Promises, Promises, Chicago, and 42nd Street before beginning a brilliant final chapter in his career that included work in films and, of course, his iconic television role of Lt. Lennie Briscoe in “Law & Order.

shows.title: The History Boys
shows.synopsis: Original Theatre (Caroline’s Kitchen, Brits Off Broadway 2019; Invincible, Brits Off Broadway 2017) return to 59E59 Theaters with the US Premiere of The Habit of Art by one of Britain’s most prolific playwrights Alan Bennett (The History Boys, The Madness of King George, and Talking Heads).

shows.title: Lestat
shows.synopsis: Thunder Media Group is proud to present the New York Premiere of An Enchanted April: a new musical, with Book & Lyrics by Elizabeth Hansen and Music & Lyrics by C. Michael Perry based on the Novel by Elizabeth von Arnim.  Under the direction of Alice Jankell, An Enchanted April is scheduled for a limited run at Theatre Two @ Theatre Row (410 West 42nd St.) opening on November 1 and running through November 16.

shows.title: The Wedding Singer
shows.synopsis: Sign up to our mailing list to receive exclusive offers, new show ticket alerts and seasonal promotions. You can unsubscribe at any time.

shows.title: Hot Feet
shows.synopsis: Best known for Eubie!, Uptown….It’s Hot!, and Hot Feet, Maurice Hines returns to Feinstein’s/54 Below in Tappin’ Thru Life with the internationally acclaimed All Female Jazz Orchestra DIVA. Along with tappers John Manzari and Leo Manzari, he pays tribute to his brother Gregory and their lives in show business, from TV to film, Broadway, Vegas, and beyond. Featuring songs like “Luck Be A Lady,” “Smile,” and “Come Fly with Me,” Tappin’ Thru Life celebrates the performers that inspire Hines, from F

creativeTeam.name: Cat Gray, Brett Laurence, Bill Meyers, Heru Ptah and Allee Willis

shows.title: The Drowsy Chaperone
shows.synopsis: Tony Award® winner Beth Leavel (The Prom, The Drowsy Chaperone) is bringing her brand new show to Feinstein’s/54 Below for two nights of fun! It’s Not About Me is a celebration of her long and storied career as one of Broadway’s biggest, belting-est divas. Join us for a night of story and song, taking you through her favorite roles she’s played, the ones that got away, and the ones she’s still chasing after. Filled with laughs and surprises, this is one show you don’t want to miss.

shows.title: Faith Healer
shows.synopsis: In "Faith Healer," a charismatic, enigmatic healer named Frank Grace travels the remote corners of the British Isles, accompanied by his loyal wife and embittered manager, each bearing a different perspective on his enigmatic powers. As they recount their intertwined stories, a captivating portrait of the nature of faith, truth, and the human condition emerges, leaving audiences pondering the line between healing and deception.

shows.title: The Caine Mutiny Court-Martial
shows.synopsis: In the midst of World War II, a young naval officer stands accused of mutiny, sparking a gripping legal battle that challenges the very foundations of military discipline. As the court-martial unfolds, tensions rise and reputations are put on the line, as the true nature of leadership and the limits of obedience are tested in this riveting courtroom drama.

shows.title: Shining City
shows.synopsis: Conor McPherson’s acclaimed Irish play, Shining City, is a gripping Dublin-based ghost story. It follows priest-turned-therapist, Ian, and his tortured widower patient, John, who holds a terrible secret. Together they unpack John’s winding story, leaving them, and those around them, altered in surprising and unforeseen ways.

shows.title: Tarzan
shows.synopsis: Join us at 54 Below as the original Off-Broadway cast of Little by Little reunites for an exclusive one-night only concert of this beloved musical! Darrin Baker, Liz Larsen, and Christiane Noll star in this celebration of favorite songs from the show including “Popcorn,” “I’m Not,” and “Take the World Away,” with lyrics by Ellen Greenfield and lyrics by Hal Hackady. The concert is produced by Brad Ross and Annette Jolles, who also returns as director.

shows.title: Waiting for Godot
shows.synopsis: Samuel Beckett's tragicomedy about two men waiting by a lonely tree for the arrival of the mysterious Godot.

shows.title: The Phantom of the Opera
shows.synopsis: Andrew Lloyd Webber's iconic musical about a mysterious masked figure who haunts the Paris Opera House and becomes obsessed with a beautiful soprano.

shows.title: Rent
shows.synopsis: Jonathan Larson's Pulitzer Prize-winning rock musical loosely based on Puccini's La Boheme, following a group of young artists and musicians struggling to survive in New York's East Village.

shows.title: Cats
shows.synopsis: Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical based on T.S. Eliot's Old Possum's Book of Practical Cats, in which a tribe of Jellicle cats gather for their annual ball to decide which cat will ascend to the Heaviside Layer.

shows.title: Les Miserables
shows.synopsis: The epic sung-through musical based on Victor Hugo's novel, following ex-convict Jean Valjean as he seeks redemption in 19th-century France amid revolution and upheaval.

shows.title: Hairspray
shows.synopsis: Set in 1960s Baltimore, plus-size teen Tracy Turnblad pursues her dream of dancing on a local TV show while fighting for racial integration.

shows.title: Avenue Q
shows.synopsis: A comedy musical featuring puppets and human actors exploring the challenges of adulthood in New York City, inspired by Sesame Street but decidedly for grown-ups.

shows.title: The Producers
shows.synopsis: Mel Brooks' record-breaking musical comedy about two theatrical producers who scheme to get rich by overselling shares in a guaranteed Broadway flop called "Springtime for Hitler."

shows.title: The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee
shows.synopsis: A hilarious musical comedy following six quirky adolescents competing in a spelling bee, with audience members pulled on stage to compete alongside them.

shows.title: Angels in America
shows.synopsis: A quarter-century after stunning the theatre world, one of the greatest theatrical journeys of our time returns to Broadway in an acclaimed new production from the National Theatre.

shows.title: The Norman Conquests
shows.synopsis: In "The Norman Conquests: Table Manners," a dysfunctional family gathers for a weekend of unexpected chaos. As the eccentric characters navigate the complexities of their relationships, a web of secrets, desires, and comedic misunderstandings unfolds, creating a hilarious and poignant exploration of the human condition. Audiences are taken on a wild ride through the absurdities of everyday life, where the lines between propriety and impropriety blur, and the search for connection becomes a delightfully unpredictable adventure.

shows.title: The Coast of Utopia
shows.synopsis: "The Coast of Utopia [Part 1 - Voyage]" takes audiences on a captivating journey through the lives of 19th-century Russian intellectuals, as they grapple with the pursuit of philosophical ideals and the ever-changing political landscape. Weaving together a tapestry of personal relationships, ideological debates, and the quest for a better world, this gripping play invites viewers to explore the complexities of human nature and the power of ideas to shape a nation's destiny.
